Reviews.Content: We spent only one night here but really enjoyed it. The food for breakfast (as mentioned by others) was superb. The rooms great and quiet. There was a street festival the night we were there (every Thursday in the summer we believe) and the streets of the main area of town were closed off - great farmer's market. Bought nectarines etc. And lots of wine to taste. We ate at a great Italian restaurant in town. The staff at the hotel recommended it and they were right. Only very small drawback was a bit of a walk into town- but we like walking and you saw a bit of the residential area. Felt very safe. The outdoor spa was just lovely- especially at night. We would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling in Napa. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: rdharris1
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Elm House Inn in June 2010. The service provided was stellar and the accomodations comfortable. Awaking each morning to the breakfast spread, which included delicious homemade muffins (particularly the cranberry/orange muffin) and waffles, several cereal options, oatmeal and fresh fruit. All of the staff were helpful with recommendations for local restaurants to visit and how to get around town. More importantly, they were attentive to the needs of guests and did their best to make sure the stay was enjoyable. Overall, our stay at the Elm House was more than we could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accomadations in every way.”
Reviews.Author: osujohn
Reviews.Content: We ended our California vacation with a one night stay in Napa at the Elm House Inn and we could not have made a better choice. From the time we arrived to departure the staff were very polite and helpful and catered to the customer's every request. The rooms are beautiful and the lobby and courtyard is a wonderful place to read or just relax while having some homemade cookies and apple cider which is served free every night at 6 p.m. The cookies are some of the best I have ever ate. The breakfast in the morning is wonderful and include's homemade item's as well. Fresh waffle's, muffin's, bagel's, pastries, cereal's and fresh fruit are delicious. They serve coffee, tea, and juice to go along with the food. The staff is very attentive and just a pleasure to be around. When we wanted to book a wine tasting tour the manager booked one for us that she thought would fit our interest and she was spot on. We had a delightful day with Darzy the owner of Homegrown tours and would book another tour with him again. He supplied a delicious lunch for us as well as taking us to some very interesting wineries. I must add I have never seen the owner/manager's of a hotel be so helpful, cheerful and pleasant as here. They set a fine example for the staff and it show's. In closing if you have the chance to visit Napa stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world service. Could not recommend enough.”
Reviews.Author: chrisedge1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we had booked with Playtpus tours for a Wine Tasting in Napa. We travelled up from San Francisco on the day of the tour and were getting picked up directly from the hotel at 10am. Realising this was too early for check-in at 9.30am we arrived at the hotel and parked and went to the front desk to enquire if it was OK to leave the car in their car park as some hotels do have some restictions around this. The conversation went as follows; "Hi were staying in your hotel tonight as we're on a wine tasting tour for the day" "Oh how absolutly fabulous!" "We just wondered if it was OK to leave our car in your car park as we're getting picked up at 10am and check in later on tonight" "Are you kidding? Of course it is - in fact in fact breakfast is still being served - go and help yourself to coffee and pastries and I'll let you know when your tour arrives". It really is the little things that make or break your hotel stay and Best Western went over and above what was expected. Needless to say our room was spotless and the rest of the stay was conducted in a similar fashion. Would not hesitate to recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Really a Bed and Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: marcia2465
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest places I've every stayed. It was actually a large house and a small house out back. I think it had around 24 rooms. The service was excellent and the food was to die for. The greatest breakfast and afternoon snacks. Couldn't ask for anything more. I hope I get a chance to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to explore the wine country from”
Reviews.Author: TerrySingapore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. It was a great location from which to do day trips to the wineries. Ted and his parents are very friendly and helpful hosts. It does have a B&B feel about it, and the breakfast and evening snack food were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: F1Crazy
Reviews.Content: We visited Napa for a night (4 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 children) as part of a 15 day CA holiday and picked this Best Western because it looked so nice on their website. We were so pleased to stay here - the staff and innkeepers are exceptional, the hotel is charming and cozy with a great location (less than 30 mins from most wineries) and within walking distance of shops, hotels and restaurants. Its a small hotel with only 30 rooms but has all the facilities you need. It feels like you are staying in a charming B&B rather than a full service hotel. The service is what makes this a fabulous place to stay. The staff is friendly and always willing to help - we were tired and wanted to eat in at dinner so we picked up some food at the local supermarket. The staff laid out plates and cutlery, helped warm up our food and even helped clear up after we were done. Sitting in the cozy lobby next to the fireplace with a glass of wine after dinner was very enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit the Napa / Sonoma area

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wallacethedog
Reviews.Content: My hhusband and I stayed here in Arpil for our first wedding anniversery. I emailed ahead to ask if i could have a champagne breakfast for our special day. The owner replied promplty and when we arrived i managed to speak to them alone. On the Sunday we had a beautiful breakfast with a bottle of Champagne. It only cost $25. It was well worth it and can recommend it to anyone. The room we stayed in was massive with a large bed. We had a seperate shower cubicle and a jaccuzi bath. My husband tested it out and he can reccomend it!!! We stayed in the seperate building next to the outside jaccuzi. We had no complaints about the room. Breakfast was out of this world, fresh waffles and everything you could want for a continental breakfast. The staff were very friendly too. They also provide hot apple cider and chocolate cookies at night time which were lovely. The staff have a box which contains vouchers for the local vine yards. We went to the Sterling Vine Yard which was only an hour away. Can recommend this. You go in a cable car up to it and sample several wines. It was really good. All in all i would say if you stay in Napa its well worth it. Napa itself seemed a little run down and several shops had closed down. So it wasnt so good for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “You will not feel that you chose poorly like in Indiana Jones”
Reviews.Author: infiniteyak
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best places that I have ever stayed. The staff and owners were friendly and helpful. The breakfast is hard to beat with waffles the size of a plate! The rooms were quiet and clean. My wife and I feel it was worth every penny. Next time we go to Napa, this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “THERE IS NO BETTER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel4ever3611
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU SO MUCH trip advisor! I choose this hotel for my recent trip to Napa and I will tell you that i will NEVER stay anywhere else in Napa and i wish they had this hotel in every city i traveled in! The hotel, which looks like a house, is so inviting and quaint, you feel at home right away! The staff, especially the inn keepers are the nicest and friendliest hotel staff i have ever seen. From the breakfast spread in the morning( the waffles were perfect), to the cider and warm cookies in the evening, it was the perfect place to come back to after a long day seeing the gorgeous vineyards of the Napa Valley! If you stay anywhere else you are missing out on a perfect hotel experience! Thank you Elm House Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night last year. The service was outstanding, as was the atmosphere. We were made to feel at home straight away by our hosts. I'm only sorry that we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, not the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: dinerdogg
Reviews.Content: I am a bit torn on this review, it's a love/hate relationship! The inn itself is so well kept and the staff is amazing. What Best Western brings you the yummiest homemade choc chip cookies, still warm, up to your room when you arrive? There is a really cute breakfast area where you can eat inside or outside and help yourself to homemade baked goods, cereals, or they will make and serve you a Belgian waffle. Our room was pretty standard but very clean and well kept. It did have a little gas fireplace in the corner which was a nice touch, although we didn't use it since our room was a bit warm being on the 3rd floor. The issues were that we couldn't have the window open because of the street noise. Also Napa the town/city is not exactly what I anticipated. It is not set amongst vineyards as you may think. It is pretty commercial and the walk to where the restaurants are takes you though a seedy area. Had I know I would've stayed in St. Helena or Calistoga (both quaint little areas closer to the wineries and a bit more upscale) but I can't fault this inn. It really was a great stay (see what I mean....torn!!) I want to move the Inn to a different location!!

Reviews.Title: “felt like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sudzman
Reviews.Content: When you see this is a best western hotel you may decide against staying here, BUT DONT. The owners of the Elm House cannot do enough for you, which means they even will cook you the perfect belgium waffle. The breakfast itself is a big reason to stay but not the only reason. The area the hotel is in is a quiet residential area just one block off of Rt.29 the main road for wineries. The hotel is kept in very nice condition with beautiful roses everywhere. The room itself was fine with 2 vanitys in the bathroom which is a nice thing to have. The owners will give restaurant suggestions and also may have some discount coupons for some winerys so just ask. My wife and I WILL stay here again in a heartbeat even if its just for the BEST CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES we have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pick for Napa”
Reviews.Author: BonBon0726
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there with our 6 month old son. We worried he wouldn't "fit in" to the quiet laid back atmospehere but every one was very nice and helpful. Pack n play was in the room when we checked in. He cried in the middle of the night two of the three nights we were there. We worried he woke the people in the room next to us but nothing was ever said. Breakfast was fabulous. Great way to start the day. Staff is very nice and knowledgeable about local restaurants. Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Karen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in the Napa Valley and the Elm House Inn proved to be the perfect place to stay. It has the charm of a bed & breakfast, but with a great deal more privacy. The innkeepers are very friendly and the entire staff is very helpful. The Inn is located at the southern end of the Rt. 29 "wine corridor," with easy access to the coast, Sonoma, San Francisco, and other nearby attractions. We'll stay there again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Hotel but beware for the Great Napa Wine Tasting Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: bractullo
Reviews.Content: Thanks again Trip Advisor. Endorse all previous glowing reviews for Elm House Inn. Our stay was most enjoyable with great personal service. Lots of lovely touches. Certainly Value-for-Money and that's what we Scots appreciate. As a complete aside from the Hotel which had nothing to do with this - watch out for the Wine Tours. The tours themselves may be well enough organised but the tastings at the wineries are a complete and utter rip-off and cost extra!!! $15 each for tastings which do not amount to one glass of wine in total. Some wineries at least waive the tasting fee if you buy a bottle but a bottle will cost a minumum of $25. The wineries should have a bar licence for that what they are doing combined with the profit they are making.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: TrixieEstero_Florida
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 wonderful days at the Elm House Inn. "Best Western" may give the wrong idea. Elm House is more like a quaint Bed & Breakfast. Our rooms were large and immaculate - overlooking the spa. The owners and hosts were more than hospitable - welcoming us on arrival after a long day of travelling with hot cider and freshly baked cookies. (and trust me these are the BEST chocolate chip cookies you will ever eat!) They bake them fresh daily and guests line up for them. The breakfasts were delicious with homemade waffles and muffins made from scratch along with fresh fruit, bagels, cereals and more. Couldn't have asked for better food. After a day of wine tasting and touring it truly felt like coming home. We liked the Napa location with many great resturants to choose from We loved it and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional find!”
Reviews.Author: texassgirl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but next time will include a longer stay in our itinerary. We have already recommended our friends stay here. We were in a separate building with an extra-large room. Very clean, comfortable bed. The service provided is what truly stands out, from helping us find dining options, to the fantastic homemade cranberry orange bread at breakfast, to custom-order waffles. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful B & B, friendly owners, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: spiffylatour
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I spent two nights at the Elm House Inn. It is conveniently located to the main roads. The rooms are well-appointed in the French Country style. The breakfast is excellent. In the early evening they offer hot cider and warm chocolate chip cookies. The owners are very helpful with suggestions regarding restaurants and entertainments for the area. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: PortlandPeg
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with husband and daughter, and two cousins traveling with us from the UK. This is a Best Western but its far from a motel, more like a B&B. Comfortable furnishings with all amenities you needed. The staff was friendly and helped us with directions and advice for take out when we were too tired to go out for dinner. The breakfast spread was incredible for continental, including made to order waffles! The hot tub was just perfect for relaxing at the end of the day. This is a great location for wine country and close to downtown Napa for a little shopping or dining. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “not if you want some sleep”
Reviews.Author: mlmUsa
Reviews.Content: Cute place,nice people, good cookies, but it is like sleeping on the freeway. There is a very busy street right next to the hotel that leads to the freeway and the traffic slows down a bit around midnight but starts again at 0500. Granted I am a light sleeper , but I don't think anyone would put up with this. We even slept with the fan on and still the traffic was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near Napa city center”
Reviews.Author: HammerBigTiime
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is very clean, quiet and in a good location. Would stay here again. Staff was friendly, very helpful recommending wineries and restaurants to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service Experience and Most Enjoyable Trip!”
Reviews.Author: oski0929
Reviews.Content: Elm House was a fantastic experience. It is convenient to freeway, the entire staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable! They were ready to offer dinner suggestions and willing to make reservations. We went on a winery tour which was AWESOME and they picked us up at the hotel. There was nothing special about our room but it had all that we needed and the beds are comfy. If you are looking for a great comfortable, quiet no huge frills then this is the place for you. The service and little extras make this place one to come back too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B feel”
Reviews.Author: SLeteneur
Reviews.Content: There isn't much more to say about this place since all of the reviews seem to be about the same. It definitely feels more like a Bed & Breakfast than a Best Western that I am used to at home. The room was comfortable and nice sized. The belgian waffles and fresh bread for breakfast were great. I also appreciated the hard boiled eggs for some protein. Like everyone mentions, the cookies in the evening were absolutely amazing. Probably the best I have ever had. The location was good but not great. You will probably need a car to get to any restaurant (as we did) but it was still very close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Laurentchr6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first trip to Napa and stayed here based off the reviews from Trip Advisor. They were right on. It has the feel and charm of a quaint bed and breakfast. The staff is fantastic, helpful, and genuine. We upgraded our room and were very impressed. We loved the breakfast in the morning, especially the different homemade breads and patiently waited for the delicious cookies served every evening. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a Brit upmarket b&b”
Reviews.Author: jik
Reviews.Content: As two women Brits only for one night in Napa we felt at home here.Don't understand earlier poster that you need a car to drive to downtown Napa-what is it with you Amis? 15-20 mins stroll to super Italo restaurant,recommended by hotel,admiring houses and upmarket shops-feet were invented before cars! We were on round trip of California, often staying in bigger hotels and found this place very friendly and homely.Only slight con is that we were about 15 mins drive from vineyards so my friend draw short straw and had to spit out wine tasters while I could enjoy...! If you like small and friendly-go there.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: h2opolofans
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets or exceeds all of the positive comments!!! It is more like a bed & breakfast than a hotel, & has the nicest & most accomodating staff we have ever run into while traveling. The location easily accesses any where one would want to go in the Napa Valley, & the personal touches (like homemade, yummy baked goods) makes one happy to wake up or "come home"!!! We were surprised at how many people liked to hang around the beautiful, homey lobby (more like a private study!!!) The whole hotel felt more like staying at a friend's private home than a Best Western! We HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Lodging”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleDan
Reviews.Content: We could have paid much more for lodging in Napa, but the Elm House Inn provided the perfect stay for our first trip to Napa Wine Country and it is perfectly located for the activities we selected. The room was spacious and clean, complementary breakfast was excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Ted recommended several restaurants for our consideration and made a last minute dinner reservation for us. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: pierre275
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very moderately priced, but offers great value. The rooms are nice, with a small fire place and refrigerator. The common area is charming, with cathedral ceilings and a large fireplace. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast really surprised us! There were pastries, hot and cold cereals, fruit, breads, eggs and waffles made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Not for first time visitors to Napa”
Reviews.Author: egim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with warm, friendly and helpful staff. However, because of its location, it is not an ideal place to stay for first time visitors to Napa because it is quite a long walk to city center. If one has been to the place and knows where to go, the hotel is a good place to spend the night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience....”
Reviews.Author: London.dreaming
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Best Western Elm House Inn and wished we could stay longer. The best part of the stay was the excellent service we received. The son of the owner - also the baker of fabulous cookies and loaves - couldn't have been nicer. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect blend of personal service, bed and breakfast coziness, and a great price.”
Reviews.Author: rocktheboat4
Reviews.Content: Took my parents here (in their 60's) and myself and a friend (in our 30's). Everyone just loved this place. The wonderful breakfast and personalized service make it feel like a bed and breakfast, but you have your own space to come back to with all the privacy you want. There is a great jacuzzi that is a nice way to start or end the day. The rooms in the back house were just wonderful. Super clean, enormous, and with nice details to them. For the price, this place can't be beat. My parents are still talking about how much they enjoyed their stay. It is not in the heart of the wineries, but few places are and they are so much more expensive. This was a five minute drive home at night, and we would get off the exit prior to bring peet's coffee back to the hotel along with the goodies we bought from Bouchon in Yountville. A wonderful end to the day...

Reviews.Title: “First time travelers to Napa and definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: wineallthetime
Reviews.Content: As you pull up it looks more like a bed and breakfast than a chain hotel. The service proved that as well. We were greeted warmly by the receptionist who gave us great tips on where to eat and where to start our wine tastings (and had 2 for 1 coupons to a few wineries) We stayed in the room with a queen bed and fireplace. It was a quiet, standard room with a very comfortable bed. The fireplace was an nice bonus as well, especially in February. As other travelers have mentioned, the breakfast was delicious. The waffles, fresh oatmeal, endless coffee, and homemade muffins and breads were delectable. In the evenings the hotel staff serviced fresh cookies and hot cider which were very enjoyable. Everyone at this hotel was incredibly warm and welcoming. My next trip to Napa will definitely include staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and affordable”
Reviews.Author: kmgerard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't go on a honeymoon immediately after the wedding, and scheduled it later this year. On our wedidng night and weekend we stayed here...and it was wonderful! The staff is absolutely great and makes you feel comfortable. The breakfast is great! Waffles, oatmeal, homemade bread mini loafs, cereal, and more! We were plenty full every morning and got to eat sitting right in front of the cozy fire. We were served by the owner and he was so nice! In the afternoon they have cider and cookies. The cookies are wonderful and it is a great treat! Our room was fairly ordinary...but when we wanted to relax, we went down and sat by the fire...so we didn't mind at all! I would HIGHLY recommend the Elm House Inn...we couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Berrnie
Reviews.Content: We booked this accommodation after reading trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We arrived at 6.00pm, just as the fresh baked cookies and warm ginger ale was being served in the atrium. The smell was so inviting! Staff were very friendly and full of helpful information about the region. The room was very comfortable and well equipped, and the breakfast was a lovely spread of fresh options. Feels more like a homely B&B than part of a hotel chain. Would love to stay again if visiting the region

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience with some truly warm hospitable inn-keepers”
Reviews.Author: marelise22
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Napa, especially if you want to walk to downtown to walk off some of the good wine and food. The inn-keepers were just such a very nice family, from the son to the Father and Mom, just super-nice!!! We were in Napa for my long birthday weekend and it was such a wonderful first stop. Next time I will stay there longer as it feels like home and they have a wonderful breakfast, and every little detail is there from the cleanliness to the robes in the room. They could not have missed a thing!! I will stay there again, and highly recommend it. It can be very confusing as to where to stay, but they have earned my loyalty. Lovely fireplace in living room as well as beautiful courtyard and sitting area. I am not sure if I shosuld be sharing this as I may want it to be a secret. A plus is the outlet mall down the road.....

Reviews.Title: “The Best Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: CountdowntoTrip
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Elm House Inn for two nights and were more than satisfied with all aspects of the Inn. We were pleasantly surprised at how small and cozy this place is and also that we were upgraded to a king sized bed. The family that runs the hotel was very friendly and went out of their way to book us reservations for dinner and for a tour. They were always happy to make recommendations and had a great deal of knowledge on a variety of restaurants. The fresh baked cookies and breads and hot apple cider were always appreciated in the early evening. The complimentary breakfast far exceeds the quality than a regular Best Western hotel. We would never stay any place else in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: daoshaug
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Elm House Inn from 26th - 30th January we can easily understand how this accommodation is so highly rated on Tripadvisor. The quality of all aspects viz hotel, room, staff and breakfast was second-to-none. We had booked a room with king-size bed and we were delightfully surprised to be upgraded to a premium room which was superb. The staff, from the time we arrived and throughtout our stay were courteous, considerate and helpful in all respects. The quality of the fare for breakfast was wonderful, with so much of what was on offer freshly-cooked. The location of the hotel was excellent being virtually adjacent to route 29. For those feeling energetic it is about a 30 minute modest stroll to the centre of Napa. This we did several times and enjoyed it very much. I can recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: travelnuts
Reviews.Content: Even though Best Western mostly offers above average accommodation, none in my experience can match the Elm House Inn . What a treat! I agree wholeheartedly with all the positive comments about this hotel. On any future visits to Napa or even to places nearby there is no question where I will stay.. The restaurant " Angele" recommended by Connie is of an equally high standard. I feel fortunate to have found both.

Reviews.Title: “If in Napa, stay here”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elm House for three nights in January. This place is the place if you're in Napa. Really convenient, GREAT staff, really, really helpful and accommodating. The reates were reasonable. Really extensive breakfast with homemade waffles and oatmeal. The reviews that describe this place as a B & B are right, but the plus in my mind is it isn't, not as confined as a B&B but with all the pluses of one. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very homely”
Reviews.Author: junodissong
Reviews.Content: It is more like a b&b but that is not a bad thing. Very friendly people, they allowed us to enjoy some wine we had bought that day from a local winery in fromt of the fire. Which was a nice end to the evening. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday treat!”
Reviews.Author: AK2NE
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the weekend to visit Wine Country. We found the hotel owners to be very friendly, accommodating of our schedule, gave great food and wine suggestions, and even served us coffee during their wonderful breakfast. It feels like a B&B, but with a much lower price than most others in Napa. Their evening cookie and cider was a surprising treat. Overall, a great place for a weekend getaway in Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Felt right at home at this cozy bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kroftygal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other reviews I read on tripadvisor and it was a great find! The staff was accommodating, the room was comfortable and the breakfast in front of the fire was just the right touch! PROS - * Afternoon cookies and hot apple cider (served around 5pm) were so yummy! They even had some fresh home baked fudge out for the holidays * Fresh belgian waffle breakfast by the fireplace (came with rate) * Cozy room with a fireplace at a reasonable rate * Close to downtown Napa * Lovely service with a smile * Outside hot tub * Robes provided in your room * Location not bad with our car (about 15 minute drive to heart of the wineries) (MINOR) CONS- * Basic bathroom and room set up - nothing too fancy * I could see parking being a problem around peak season * No view from our room - just the parking lot * Location is not in the heart of it all and not the prettiest spot but we felt safe Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and have to say this is the best Best Western we have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: IS83
Reviews.Content: Think about the very best hotel stay you've ever had. This was 20 times better than that. The family that runs the Elm House (and over the one night stay we had, we know them all by name) treat every guest like their closest friends. Before we even arrived, we called and spoke with Connie to arrange our wine tour (she set us up with the best in town) and we felt her warm welcome. When we arrived in this lovely, cottage style Inn we felt like we were inside a home, with a fireplace stoked and gingerbread smell in the air. There was a fresh breakfast waiting for us (complimentary, of course) with fresh oatmeal (with traditional toppings to fun, festive ones like chocolate covered raisins), home made GINGERBREAD Belgium waffles, and other delicious treats. Connie greeted us with a genuine cheerful glow, she knew exactly who we were, and had everything arranged and waiting for us so all we had to do was get on the tour! Our wine tour ended up being the two of us girls, and her daughter who was in town visiting with a couple friends! We had a lovely time and upon returning, I snuggled in the comfy bed for an afternoon nap. The room was big, and had everything I could possibly need. When we decided to get dinner, Tom, Connie's husband recommended a lovely Tapas place. We tried to go and our rental car wouldn't start, well Tom saw us go upstairs to the room with a sad look on our faces and immediately called up to see what he could do. He ended up making sure we had a wonderful, safe, and fast trip to the restaurant, going to lengths that were above and beyond anything that he could have been expected to do. The next morning, Teddy, Tom and Connie's son, greeted us at breakfast with a lovely smile and fresh waffles. He asked us all about our trip and to see if there was anything else he could do to help us out. I cant believe that in a 24 hour trip we were able to feel so taken care of and welcomed into not just an Inn, but a family. We really loved Napa, but without the Elm House, it wouldn't have been nearly as lovely, relaxing, and special. It is a 5 star hotel secretly placed inside an affordable, adorable (and did I mention, clean?) Inn. Thank you so much to the Elm House Family, we recommend this place wholeheartedly, and can't wait for our friends and family to experience it as well.

Reviews.Title: “A B&B in disguise”
Reviews.Author: Don_Rose
Reviews.Content: I know it says it's a Best Western Motel, but it's closer to a traditional B&B. We were in one of the five rooms on the first floor. It was so easy to just open our door and slip out to the "lobby" to get that first cup of coffee in the morning. Then you can get dressed and have your "continental breakfast" with real oatmeal waiting in the crock-pot instead of a package of instant oatmeal and a hot water tap, waffles cooked by a real person instead of the do-it-yourself machine, and coffee cake still hot from the oven. Evenings had hot cider and freshly baked chocolate cookies. (No, they won't give out the recipe.) The staff was available and eager to share restaurant recommendations. And the WiFi worked too,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, romantic could you ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: mark4fi
Reviews.Content: From check in to departure the family atmosphere was clear and welcoming. At the outset it was obvious that they would do everthing they could to enhance your stay. The cider and home made cookies helped us to relax and unwind after what had been a long and active day. Cleanliness and efficient in everything they do and when requested a little extra something for the room after proposing on balloon trip they happily went above and beyond and not only put in a cold bottle of bubbly as requested but added their own individual touch with rose petals and fruit to match. An amazing stay and could not have asked for a better hotel to come home to after an understandably stressful day. Only regret is not staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Outstanding Value!”
Reviews.Author: WorldShuffler
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the Elm House Inn--clean and well maintained, with an excellent breakfast, comfortable rooms and a very warm welcome. Plus, a convenient location, with easy on/easy off Hwy 29 in North Napa city. Having been disappointed too many times with small independent inns and their clueless innkeepers, this was a VERY pleasant surprise. The owners clearly understand what travelers want/need, and how to give it to them while remaining profitable. (Yup, it's all in the details.) An outstanding value in often pricey Napa Valley. Will stay again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves all the good reviews !”
Reviews.Author: FFP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Arrived early as we were going on a wine tour. Plan was to get some recommendations for coffee only to be offered coffee from the breakfast bar. Room was great, quiet location, really comfy and clean. Apple cider and cookies at 6 was a great addition. Owners were incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the morning was first class and the hot tub was a great way to finish the evening. Slight walk into town (20 mins or so) but it was a nice easy walk to work up an appetite and walk it off ! Can't think of anything negative and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: CopakeWillow
Reviews.Content: It's not too big, but is beautiful, has everything you need and feels very homey. The service is perfect -- friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and helpful, but not pushy. The rooms are beautiful, spotless and very comfortable. The breakfast is delicious, varied and all fresh and wonderful. You can bring your wine and some cheese and crackers and sit in front of the fire in the afternoon or evening. It's right in Napa close to all the wineries, but also to the outlet stores and downtown. We -- my husband and I also another couple we were traveling with -- liked it so much we stayed an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: runamuk77
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel! Small. Quiet. We loved coming into the lobby with the roaring fire and the smell of cider and cookies after an afternoon of wine tours. Breakfast was out of the world! Oatmeal, waffles, fresh bakes muffins.. Lovely friendly people work here. We were able to walk to most restaurants in Napa from the Elm House. We highly recommend this! Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: lewiejay
Reviews.Content: BW Elm House Inn was a delightful Surpirse. Despite having the BW logo it has the look and feel of a B&B. Rooms were very well appointed and totally clean. Breakfasts were way beyond what one expects from a Best Western. Elm House owners and staff strive to make their guests' lodging experiences superior, and they succeed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the bestest western”
Reviews.Author: jojo56
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great. breakfast- waffles, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, toast, juice, freshly baked breads. every day the spread was different. the afternoon cookie break was awesome. we asked for the recipe. sadly, we did not get it. the rooms are average, very old fashioned, but they were clean. in the lobby, there is a box of coupons to alot of the local vineyards (awesome). and every who works there is great, very friendly and ready to give you suggestions for everything. there is a whole foods down the st.

Reviews.Title: “As fabulous as the reviews state”
Reviews.Author: rls87621
Reviews.Content: Not sure what more I can share that hasn't already been stated, but the EHI is wonderful. It's charming, exceptionally clean, quiet and has a FANTASTIC complimentary breakfast. It's the best of a hotel and B&B combined. We stayed in a "king bed, no smoking, garden view" that was actually a separate building from the main building (separated by a short, 30 second walk through the garden, past the spa). The room was enormous with a separate sitting area, desk, a large bathroom with shower and a tub, a walk-in closet with another sink/vanity area, mini-fridge, free Wi-Fi, cable tv... The owners take great pride in making guests feel welcome and are happy to share information and recommendations on the area.

Reviews.Title: “Like a B & B”
Reviews.Author: arichterga
Reviews.Content: I came here for my 40th birthday with a group of family and friends. We all LOVED this hotel!!! The owners are very involved in the running of this Inn and take a lot of pride in ensuring that the guests are taken care of. It has the feel of a well-run B & B. We were greeted at the door and the staff already knew who we were and that this was a special occasion. My boyfriend and I stayed in the suite. It was HUGE and GORGEOUS. Two sinks, a walk in closet, a huge shower, a jacuzzi tub (small), TV, free wi-fi. The gardens are well tended with fountains and big, fragrant roses. Every morning from 7:30 until 10:00 there is complimentary breakfast. OMG. The waffles were some of the best we have had. Each morning there were waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal, fresh squeezed OJ, oatmeal, and an array of toppings for the oatmeal. And I could write a whole review about the bread they cooked every morning for breakfast: orange cranberry with orange icing one morning, almond poppy the next, and pumpkin raisin with icing the final day. Although we had our trip planned they can recommend vineyards and restaurants and have maps to help guide you. They also have board games available for kids. Very cozy, great service, and personal touches. Would definitely recommend this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Like a bed & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: djjjc
Reviews.Content: Don't let the "Best Western" name fool you. This is run by a family and has the look and feel of a bed & breakfast. The staff was so accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sellfor21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Elm House Inn, Napa Ca. We enjoyed our stay. We woke every morning to the Fresh brew of coffee and Waffles. The owners Tom & Connie were very helpful with ideas of where to go eat and things to do. They have a box of coupons on the table and invite you to use them. Every evening when we came back from a long day, there was always someone sitting infront of the fire place drinking cider and eating homemade cookies. A very friendly place I couldn't say enough about the welcoming feeling when staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pisendel
Reviews.Content: We used this Inn as our base of operations to visit wineries in the Napa Valley and also for a day touring Sonoma. It is a very pleasant and well kept inn, with helpful staff. Our room was reasonably sized, and the bathroom was quite modern and very clean. One feature we really liked was that they had a breakfast buffet open from 730am - we've stayed at B&Bs with splendid breakfasts but they tend to start much later and take quite a bit of time, and we were anxious to hit the road each day and not spend the entire morning eating breakfast. The buffet had fresh baked pastries, fresh fruit, cereals, both hot and cold, yogurt, hardboiled eggs etc. We had waffles one morning. It was always ready on time, or even earlier, and the setting was quite lovely. There was a hot tub outside which we didn't use but saw other guests enjoying themselves in it. Parking was great, and the hotel is very easily found just off the main highway heading into Napa from SF. Downtown Napa is quaint with lots of nice restaurants, and is an easy 20 minute walk from the inn, or you can drive and find plenty of parking. We would certainly recommend it to anyone traveling to this area, and will return ourselves should we have the opportunity to return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: annagram09
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable Inn. They recommended an excellent restaurant for dinner in Napa. The room and its bathroom were very good value. I was worried that it might be noisy as our room was on a corner on th first floor, but it was quiet all night and we slept well. Having the breakfast included was a great idea. Parking was included too.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME INN . ..A MUST STAY for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ssport
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good about this Charming Inn. If I were to travel to Napa again, I would stay here every chance I could. We had the pleasure of Tom as the front desk clerk and also "master" baker!! The beds and pillows are SOO comfy!! The free afternoon snacks were soooo good!!!! and the free breakfast was amazing!!!! Homemade goodies abound, actually fresh right from their oven! Better then any other place we have stayed. I would pay for the recipes!! Personality and charm. They also provide 2 comfy robes. They make the beds ..sheet/blanket/sheet...the way they should be made!! The outdoor spa area was clean and beautiful. The lobby is comfortable and inviting. They have a neat binder with most of the local restaurant menus and prices. They also provide a box of tasting coupons from many of the local wineries. If you are a light sleeper then you might want to ask for a room away from the lobby and street side, around 4AM the traffic begins. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! Cannot upload pics right now.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: iceal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this last week. Great hotel. Nice,clean,comfortable rooms. Outstanding breakfast to get your day started. Staff was very helpful and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Give this Best Western a 10+”
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! The service was sensational! Immaculate. Breakfast was over the top with freshly made waffles to order plus everything else. We arrived at 6 PM and the aroma of freshly baked homemade cookies from scratch permeated the lobby. Our rooms were spacious and spotless.The hotel owners were personally there to make suggestions,book reservations,print our boarding passes and help in any way. Great location close to everything! We feel like we found a gem. We're making reservations to stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: fraire
Reviews.Content: This hotel really goes out of its way to make guests feel at home! The situation is ideal for anyone visiting Napa and the valley. Although it's not right in the centre, it's not far to walk downtown through the quiet streets, and it only takes a couple of minutes by car if you're lazy. We had a double queen room which was huge, spotlessly clean, extremely comfortable and met all of our needs entirely. The extra wash-hand basin just outside the bathroom is a great plus when there's four of you. The decoration may not be slap bang up to date, but it's kind of homely and comforting. For the tired and weary after all that wine-tasting, shopping ( Outlet stores close by ) and laundry ( coin operated in the hotel itself - great !) there's even a hot tub too, in a lovely garden at the back. The breakfast was simply delicious, as others have said - definitely not your average hotel morning fare - and just the thought of the hot cider and homemade cookies late afternoon makes my mouth water. If you're looking for a good hotel in Napa, then, don't hesitate, just book this one. For the price ( and you are in Napa after all, so don't expect it to be rock bottom !) you can't beat it for pleasant, old-fashioned comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: JBTucson
Reviews.Content: The staff makes this place a gem. The owners, their son Ted, and the rest of the staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and will provide you with tips, coupons, and directions to make your stay more enjoyable. The room we had was comfortable, clean, and good-sized but not opulent. Most Best Westerns are not. The hotel is located in the City of Napa, close to Hwy 29, but not really within walking distance of anything. Parking is somewhat limited and you might have a problem finding a spot if the hotel is full and you come back late in the evening. Breakfast was very good, especially the excellent waffles and backed goods. This would be high on our list if we return to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations in every way”
Reviews.Author: ElThomo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the look of an inn from the outside, beautifully maintained and with first class rooms/facilities. Okay it has a little bit of a motel feel to it once you're inside and it feels a bit strange walking straight out of your room onto the breakfast area, but this really doesn't matter when the service and attention to detail beats other much higher priced hotels by a long way. Its obvious the owners want you to feel at home and go out of their way to add nice touches such as home baked cookies in the afternoon with hot mugs of their warm apple cider!! The visit was worth it just for the cookies. Breakfast waffles freshly cooked also added to the feel of the place. The owner promised we would see even more facilities and new features for our next visit and to be honest I hope we will have a next visit as this is a great hotel to base yourself for a visit to Napa. If you want overpriced, chintzy, mock victorian bed and breakfast then you can walk round the corner from the Elm House and see it, but my recommendation is save your money and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winelovergirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews for the Elm House Inn on this site, I booked a an anniversary trip for myself and my husband in September 2009. I was skeptical due to the low price as compared to other Napa hotels but I was very pleasantly surprised. There are just a couple of people who work here and they are so attentive and helpful. They personally greet you as you come and go, offer suggestions, and basically just treat you like family. When you come downstairs, someone is right there offering to make you a hot waffle or whatever else you would like. The staff is the best part of this hotel. The location is very convenient - right off Highway 29 which is the main route through wine country, and less than a mile from downtown Napa. The room was very spacious and clean, and had great windows and a fireplace. Parking and internet were both free! Everything about this hotel makes it an excellent value and we will be staying here again on our next visit to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Justified - It's great!”
Reviews.Author: SimonRufus
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful two night stay in Sept 2009. There are many glowing reviews and I think theyâ€™re all justified. Price: Our budget was in mind when booking a place in Napa and the Elm House was right in the middle, not the cheapest thing in Napa, but not $300+ a night either. We felt it was a great value when you consider how much you â€œgotâ€� compared with how much you spent. We stayed in the room above the office and not at anytime were there noises from downstairs or in the hallway (or from other rooms for that matter), pretty well insulated. We were also on the street side and couldnâ€™t really notice any street noise. I was surprised on how large the room was, I would say itâ€™s probably one and a half to maybe twice as big as a â€œtypicalâ€� hotel room at a chain hotel. Breakfast was great as mentioned. Fresh mini banana nut bread one day with cranberry orange the next. Very tasty. Waffles were great, fruit was fresh, coffee was hot. We also took advantage of the hot ciders and cookies each night as a night cap after dinner and before bed. Nice to unwind out on their little patio. Bed was comfortable. Shower was big, good pressure, and clean. Location: I actually preferred the location close to Highway 29 as opposed to being downtown. We only went downtown one evening, but it seems like we were on and off 29 a lot as we ventured up to the wineries and around town. Would recommend to friends who would visit out there. Donâ€™t book the high end, save a little money and bring back some more wine.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hospitality”
Reviews.Author: boardthedogandgo
Reviews.Content: The staff at The Elm House Inn were awesome. They were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms were spacious (we stayed in the newer building), clean and well appointed. The grounds are quaint, plenty of outdoor seating. The breakfast is superb. The only drawback is the distance from restaurants and shopping. It's walkable but is slightly less than a mile.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: sanstique
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little Inn with excellent service and a homey atmosphere. It is located very close to CA-29 with easy access to the wineries. Breakfast was substantial and healthful, the cookies, etc. in the evening were a nice touch. It is also in easy walking distance of downtown Napa for dinner after the wine tours are done. Enjoy, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Best place we ever stayed in the valley”
Reviews.Author: bkperal
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had been to Napa valley for 3 times. We stayed in Yontsville & St. Helena for rhe good restaurants sake, but they were expensive, nothing standed out. This time we chose the #1 TripAdvisor recommanded, and it really lived up to its standard. First of all, the service from all the staff were warm & friendly. Tom & Karen are exceptional. They did the extra(offer you nice dinner plate when we ordered the take out,) recommand nice restaurants & wineries we didn't explored before. The breakfest were as good as expensive B&B. Check them out if you are heading to this area, we are definitely going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: phizzak
Reviews.Content: This place just felt like it belonged in wine country; everything from the decor to the exceptional staff/owners. We checked in during the afternoon and there were fresh lemon cakes to be had. After having dinner near the river (which is about 2 mins away), we came back and there were freshly baked chocolate chip cookies. They also had complimentary tea/coffee/water available all day. I've stayed at many nicer hotels, but none were quite as welcoming as this. The rooms were cozy, clean and there was even a fireplace in the corner, which was a nice touch. We did a lot of research prior to booking here and I'm glad we stayed here rather than some $300/night place. As other posters have mentioned, they have awesome freshly made waffles for breakfast. Along with that, there were: grapefruit, apples, oranges, hardboiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, pastries and juice/coffee. The spread was quite impressive, and best of all, it's included! The location is great if you want to explore the Napa wineries or just head downtown. I suggest working North to South so that you can end your day near the Inn, restaurants, outlets, and shops downtown. We met the husband who runs the place with his wife and he was a real down-to-earth person, and genuinely nice and appreciative of our business. I have never tried a B&B, but if it's anything like this, I will be seeking them out! I loved this place and will be recommending it to all of my friends and family who head to napa/sonoma. The #1 ranking on trip advisor is well deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: holadebbo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel! We spent two nights there over the Labor Day weekend. There is the main hotel building and a smaller building in the back. We had two rooms in the back building, both with comfortable king sized beds. The rooms were large and immaculate. The bathrooms were spotless and there was an extra sink in the closet area which was very handy. Breakfast is included...waffles, oatmeal, pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juice. There were individual loaves of banana and lemon poppyseed bread fresh out of the oven. Waffles are made for you upon request. The cookies and cider in the early evening are wonderful too. The owners take great pride in their hotel and it shows. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elm House in late August 2009, and we booked this as a last minute trip from San Francisco. We had a nice room located in the back house of the property. Rooms are not newly decorated, but the property is small in guest size, clean, and in walking distance to downtown Napa (15-20 minutes). We would stay here again if visiting this region of wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - like a B&B - will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: babystepstraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what my husband or I expected from a Best Western, even with the good reviews. It was clean and quaint; the woman at the front desk was very helpful and gave us coupons and maps for some great boutique wineries. The breakfast was excellent considering it was included in the price. The rooms were big and clean, the bathroom was spacious - our bath tub did have jets, but neither of us tried them. I would absolutely return to this hotel next time we go to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome home!”
Reviews.Author: m_chu_lovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We love, love, love this place! My family was very impressed. We have stayed at many five star hotels and our room at this Best Western was one of the cleanest we have ever seen. Also, the service was amazing! Their continental breakfast was impressive and the afternoon treats were delicious! The staff was friendly, curtious and attentive... I give the Best Western Elm House 5 stars and look forward to our next stay! Believe me and others when we say this is, definitely, not your average Best Western. The owners have gone out of their way to make your stay in Wine Country one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice”
Reviews.Author: irishinealing
Reviews.Content: Well this is a lovely little Best Western. They have really put their heart and soul into it. You even get robes (which you don't in the five star Bellagio in Vegas!). It has free parking outside, very handy. Big room. It's very handy for the wineries, it's pretty much a straight run. It's probably a mile from town so not as convenient as I thought (problem if you both want to drink as you'll have to walk). The road down to the side of the motel is just too pretty for words, it's like a chocolate box scene. It's real 'white picket fence' country, just charming and quaint and gorgeous. I wanted to live in Napa after walking down that road! The staff are very friendly. The owner makes chocolate chip cookies every afternoon, they are the BEST COOKIES I HAVE EVER EATEN. EVER!! They are served with pear cider (warm), it's just delicious and welcoming and sweet. Had waffles for brekkie next day, very nice. There are lots of places in town to get brekkie though and I do love a big American breakfast so I'd recommend going out for breakfast. The vineyards themselves are divine. Go to the visitor centre in Napa town centre, they very kindly give you a list of things you might enjoy, you tick the ones you like, then they tell you which wineries are the best ones to suit your tastes! It's brilliant. We went to Beringer and Silverado, really beautiful. Beringer is old and full of tradition. Silverado looks very contemporary and has a cable car ride up to it. You get divine views over Napa. The tours are fantastic, well thought out, great value for money, fab friendly staff. I want to go back and see lots more. Oh, stay away from the fake castle winery, we drove in and drove straight back out - it looks like cheap tack. Maybe it's great on the inside, but on the outside it's a hideous eye sore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: genelary
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at the Elm House Inn, and we were very pleased again. The rooms are large and clean. The only complaint we had was the air conditioner cycled on and off all night. Great cookies in the afternoon, and also a nice breakfast in the morning. It is also reasonably priced for the area.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: likeslocalstuff
Reviews.Content: Sweet, intimate and friendly place. Folks staying there are so comfortable there they actually leave their rooms to hang out off the patio, or in the common room. We came in late and knew about their cookies per the reviews here. We thought we had missed out on them. The hostess noticed us looking and said I have more in the oven and will bring up some to your room. Rooms are clean and have a/c. It was cozy almost like you were visiting a relative at their home. Old fashioned but inviting. Only downside was that they are on a busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Met with blueberry banana bread”
Reviews.Author: cartist
Reviews.Content: A lovely atmosphere with fresh baking throughout the day. Waffles for breakfast (as well as healthier fare), blueberry-banana bread at hand throughout the day and then chocolate-chip cookies in the evening. The hosts were very helpful in their recommendations for wine-tasting tours and restaurants throughout the area. A comfortable and inviting inn to return to at the end of a day of wine-tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that makes you feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelersMiami
Reviews.Content: Oh My God. The waffles. Ted, the owners son makes the absolute best waffles instantly when you arrive at breakfast. They are moist, warm, fluffy with warm syrup and the smell of the waffles emmanates throughout the breakfast area (we actually smelled them in our room when we woke up since our room was at the top of the stairs), and there were sides of nuts, blue berries, raisins... Ted is a warm and hospitable host. You eat in the dining room that is so cozy and he and his dad make sure there are a wide variety of fruits (bananas, grape fruits, speciality oranges, melons, etc. Ted makes homemade blueberry bread, and other goodies. In the afternoon his delicious chocolate chip cookies and warm apple cider are served. THIS WAS INCLUDED WITH OUR HOTEL RATE. They have roses on the table from their garden, and I could go on and on. HOT coffee. You get the picture. But most of all they want to make you feel right at home. They volunteered to print map quests. They gave good advice on restaurants and wineries. It was a great experience. The hotel room was very comfortable. It was large, with lots of towels; nice shampoo, soap and bath salts with a powerful hot tub in the bathroom that two persons easily fit in. The room had a fireplace that you hit the switch to turn on. I was worried about staying at a Best Western since I usually frequent five star hotels. My bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. I now understand why this place was rated number 1 by trip advisor visitors to Napa. We add our vote that it stay number 1. Jack and Sherry

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jenrainey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, conveniently located & provided many little extras that made our stay special. The staff was wonderful & very personable. There were fresh cookies or brownies nightly; a nice breakfast every morning; and a fire place in every room. While this is not a luxery hotel, we couldn't have asked for more. It was perfect for our stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsy00
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, definitely the nicest best western I've stayed at. It definitely has the feel of a B&B as others have said. The inn keepers are superb, very friendly, and will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. And, the food is quite tasty. A couple of notes: 1. The hotel is about a 20-25 min walk to downtown. It is a nice walk however, through some beautiful old residential neighborhoods. 2. The one complaint (minor) that I have is that our room was directly off the common breakfast area. Most of the other rooms are more secluded/private. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “an excellent motel”
Reviews.Author: evan7
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else on trip advisor we were very impressed with the Elm House. They Inn Keepers (Tom and Connie) really try hard to make everyone's stay enjoyable. They have coupons for two for one wine tasting (the tasting fees have gone crazy in Napa), they will loan you a laptop if you didn't bring yours and the place is extremely nice for the price/location. If you like mdern art there is a fabulous art gallery at Hess Winery. Also there is some wonderful outdoor sculptures and other art at Clos Pagaso (which is across the street from Sterling, which I would advise skipping).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: joedee656
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a trip to Napa. We stayed at this hotel because it was one of the more affordable hotels in the area. We were so pleasantly suprised. The room was fine-nothing fancy. The service by the staff (mostly family members) was amazing. We were given explicit directions to get everywhere we wqanted to go and terrific advice on what to see (and miss) in Napa. They were more than willing to print out directions on google maps for us and answered every one of our many questions without hesitation. The best part of the stay, however, was the breakfast which was included in the price of the hotel. There was the standard breakfast fare and in addition, there was a freshly baked cake or muffin daily and the option of a waffle, cooked to order. There was definitely a feeling like we were in a fancy bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Europhile_Pacific
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, although it was slightly annoying to receive directions verbally only and not have them written down on a MAP. Breakfast was excellent. The room was spacious and the bed reasonably comfortable but there were spots on the bedspread. The bathroom was OK. Our room, on the first floor, was on the same level as the parking outside and windows were left open by the cleaning staff, even though we had closed them before leaving for the day. Privacy might be an issue if you don't want to be seen exiting the room with your lover in the morning, as the first-floor rooms open right onto the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, you won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: delkins
Reviews.Content: From the clean rooms, to the great breakfast, to one of the best run small inns I've every had the pleasure to stay at. This great little family run inn is the place to stay if your travel plans take you to Napa. With everything overpriced and overhyped in Napa it's great to have a place like this to just kick back and relax at.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and Breakfast feel without B&B Bucks”
Reviews.Author: Lookie_Lew
Reviews.Content: I combined a business trip at the City of American Canyon with the pleasure of staying in the small town of Napa. I didnâ€™t get there until around 8:00 PM. In the lobby I found a delicious warm Apple Cider/Cinnamon drink and a helpful person at the desk. The lobby and in fact the whole place had a cozy â€œbed and breakfastâ€� feel rather than what you expect from a Best Western â€œmotelâ€�. The room was immaculate and very homey as well. I much prefer to stay in mom and pop places like this rather than the big impersonal cookie cutter hotels. They had free high speed Internet which was important to me with my business. I got a great night sleep and in the morning they had laid out a breakfast spread with homemade (on site) blueberry cake, yogurt parfaits, coffee, eggs, fresh fruit and waffles made by the staff â€“ no do it yourself stuff you usually get. All in all a great home style place to meet people staying in NAPA and share stories. Itâ€™s like staying in an expensive bed and breakfast without shelling out the big bucks. My room with the AAA discount was $181.00.

Reviews.Title: “A great little Inn....”
Reviews.Author: KAMCE
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in Napa for our 10th wedding anniversary! I read the reviews on TripAdvisor for a place to stay and this is the one we picked. We were not disappointed! It is so quaint and wonderful. We got a room upgrade and it was so nice. We had a little sitting area, fireplace, bed and bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. The breakfast in the morning is the best "continental" breakfast we've every had. Fresh belgian waffles, cereals, pastries, oatmeal, coffee and juices! The whole Inn smells like waffles in the morning! The staff was great as well as the location. Easy to get anywhere from here and you could easily walk to a number of restaurants. It was a great way to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: TracieNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of the Trip Advisor reviews, and it didn't disappoint. The staff was so friendly and accomodating; they helped us with everything from a good running route to restaurant reservations. The room we had was very big, bright, and comfortable, and the breakfast was superb. They had waffles, oatmeal, yogurt parfaits, fresh baked muffins and breads, fruit, and I'm sure I'm forgetting more. Regardless of the specific choices, all of it was delicious. One thing to know: the Elm House Inn is located very close to a busy intersection, so if your windows are open (and ours were), you can hear street noise. We didn't care, and it really wasn't a big deal, but it's something to consider. That said, because of its location, it is very convenient to many activities. If we were to return to Napa, we would stay there again; we wouldn't even bother checking other places.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Michellllllllle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Elm House Inn for two nights. We absolutely loved it. We have not ever stayed in a bed and breakfast before, and we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The Inn Keepers are what made the stay go from good to excellent though. They REALLY CARE about their guests. They are happy to be there, and happy to take care of their guests. The cookies and waffles were phenoninal (read about them on this website, and they did NOT disappoint!) Don't even hesitate - STAY HERE! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But Surely Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: sweetpolly13
Reviews.Content: I didn't feel quite the same level of "love" that most reviewers on this site did. The inn is fine and comfortable, and service (for the most part) was exceptionally friendly and helpful). Our room was fairly spacious, but could definitely use some updating and "cutening up". Bed was okay. There were some little things that irritated me...the door to our room opened right into the lobby, which got pretty noisy in the A.M. when breakfast service began; the single sink drained at a snail's pace (surely housekeeping has noticed a need for Drano when cleaning it); the shower is little more than a curtained off area of the bathroom with a drain...there's no lip to it, so water got all over the bathroom floor when we showered; and the lowest setting for our A/C was pretty high and it would not turn on at all in the evenings. I get hot flashes at night, so that made me rather cranky. :/ On the more positive side, the location was nice for exploring wine country. It's about 3/4 of a mile from the downtown Napa area (a pleasant and safe walk with plenty of sidewalks and streetlights). The inn sits on a fairly high-traffic road, but we were not disturbed by vehicular noise as everything slows way down at night. Breakfast was included, which I would classify as a high-end continental breakfast (no protein other than hard-boiled eggs, but the baked goods, waffles, yogurt parfaits and fruit were top-notch). And again, the staff were super-friendly and accommodating (except for one younger member who didn't show much concern when I inquired about why we couldn't get the A/C to run at night). I liked the free wireless internet, too. The three stars I'm giving Elm House seems a little weak, but four seems too generous. I'd give it about a 3.5 if I could. Again, it was fine overall...but I'm not sure it warrants a $250/night price tag.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Napa, very comfortable, amazing hosts.”
Reviews.Author: JaimeV
Reviews.Content: I can't talk enough about the wonderful hosts of the Inn. They helped with recommendations, they made wonderful snacks and an incredible breakfast in the morning. They were SO friendly and welcoming. The Inn isn't anything like a Best Western. It's like a bed & breakfast with more modern amenities. The room was nice, we were on the second floor in the main building. The windows opened, so we had nice fresh air. The ENTIRE place is planted with beautiful flowers. They have them all over inside too. It's really charming. The breakfast/living room area is comfortable and quaint. The wireless connection was very good, could get it quickly and easily. We were so pleased with this hotel. The location is just fine to see all of Napa. We drove up and down both sides several times. There's no reason to pay double or triple to stay in Yountville or St Helena. We got the best rate from their website with the pre-pay option. I would definitely stay here again, it was a really lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa County”
Reviews.Author: jrw88888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway. I think "Inn" is the perfect term, it really is more like a bed-and-breakfast than a motel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The evening cookies and apple cider are a treat. The morning breakfast was better than at any Napa B&B. The rooms in the main building are nice. We upgraded to the superior room in the detached building. The room was enormous. (For instance, the "closet" even had its own sink.)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SashaP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at this hotel last week while on our way to wine country. Although we truly enjoyed the hotel, the hotel's location was not what I expected. The hotel is located right in the middle of town on a busy street; we had a little trouble with street noise, but other than that we have no complaints. The hotel has, i would guess, 20 rooms? The rooms were spacious and clean. the bathroom was clean and had a heat lamp which was a nice touch. Breakfast was great as well. It was a regular continental spread, but with the nice touch of homemade sweet breads (that was great!) and personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: K26101W
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe this was a Best Western. It looked like a quaint little bed and breakfast. The staff was so great and they served a great breakfast in the morning and afternoon tea. It was a bit outdated but very clean and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's a deal during high season”
Reviews.Author: FirstPlace
Reviews.Content: We don't live very far away but were celebrating our anniversary so decided to stay one night mid week, at a local B&B. When our plans changed and we needed to also stay a Friday night, our B&B was already booked. Getting a hotel room for a Friday night only is very hard during the season in Napa. Elm House came through for us. As nice as all the staff is, a wonderful breakfast, beautiful roses on all the tables and great cookies in the evening, it is still a Best Western. The difference between a mid week stay at the best room in the top ranked B&B, and a Friday stay here was about $40. So possibly that is coloring my view somewhat. Considering what some other places wanted for the same time period, the Elm House will always beat them hands down. Everything said in other reviews about the staff is true. They are great. We checked out of our B&B and did not want our wine purchases to sit in the car all day, so we took a chance that our room at the Elm house would be ready. It was! We checked in about 10:00 am. Being almost local, we usually try to time our overnight stays to the off season when prices are more reasonable. If you need a weekend during the season, this is a great choice and one we would come back to. Just know that you are paying for the location of Napa Valley and not the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly, but not that cheap even with a discount - it's Napa!”
Reviews.Author: benmychree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House Inn in Napa for 2 nights at the start of April. We were shocked at the ridiculous prices run of the mill inn or bed and breakfast places wanted in Napa, so we were pleased to get a room at the Inn for a discounted price, especially considering it is rated No. 1 by TA members. All things considered however, Napa hotels have rip-off prices, and although we did get a discounted price, considering what you are actually getting for your money, it still does not represent great value, so although everything about the Elm House Inn was fine in our view, we are marking it down on value. Check in was simple, and the young female receptionist was friendly, informative and welcoming. Our room was on the first floor. There is a small lift if you have a lot of luggage like we did, but being a small inn you are on your own in moving it, which is fine considering how close your room is. The room was a decent size, and as expected decorated in a homely old-fashioned style which is consistent with the hotel and its location. It was perfectly adequate for our needs. The bed was comfortable and warm, and there was a TV, although donâ€™t go expecting movie packages or even a particularly clear picture for the available channels. The inclusive breakfast in the lounge area downstairs was a good way to start the day. There is a selection of juices and cereals, pastries, toast, waffles, fruit, etc. The waiting staff (which includes the person on reception â€“ multi-tasking is the order of the day here!) were very friendly and efficient. All staff, including the owner, were very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. We had a small problem with the bathroom sink and it was sorted out really quickly. The lounge is welcoming, with a fire and some sofas, and there is a lot of literature about local attractions and activities. There is some seating outside and also a small jacuzzi, but this was closed as the weather was not warm enough yet to open it for the year. There is also a guest laundry area, which we found very useful having been touring around for 3 weeks. The Inn is a small, cosy, welcoming sort of place, and we had no complaints at all about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Napa! An authentic wine country stay!”
Reviews.Author: LaBellerina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel a couple weeks ago and it was amazing! We've been to many nice hotels but this was the first time we felt really relaxed and comfortable and cozy, as well as really welcomed from the staff. Everyone who works there genuinely cares if you're happy and having a good time. I couldn't believe how much trouble they went to in making sure we had our day all planned out, suggesting places that turned out to be perfect for us. Best trip, best hotel, I will be back as often as possible!!! LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! : )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovenicehotels
Reviews.Content: The Best Western was wonderful! The staff is very welcoming and gave my husband and I a very nice, large room which was spotless. They have an EXCELLENT breakfast that is free, serve some of the best cookies I've ever had every evening around 5pm- everything in the room worked like a charm, AC, shower, TV. Room had a refrigerator which was nice, check out was simple, they had great dinner recommendations, free, easy parking, I can't say enough good things about this place. It was fantastic and pay no attention to the fact that it is a Best Western, I can't wait to go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Napa....pass it on”
Reviews.Author: Sad2BHomeDenver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at the Best Western Elm House Inn after researching it on Trip Advisor. Our previous stays in Napa have been at Bed and Breakfasts at almost double the cost. It was our anniversary weekend and thought we had booked the King Suite. (We booked through Best Western, not the inn itself) When I asked about the confusion, Miriam changed our room immediately. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. (for less than $200 per night, we had a jacuzzi tub and fireplace!) The grounds were beautiful and it was a nice cozy blend of B&B and small boutique inn. Fresh flowers, lit candles and the most decadent chocolate chip cookies were waiting in the evenings. The breakfasts were delicious with a deluxe style continental breakfast, of homemade coffee cakes (Ted, I'll still arm wrestle you for the recipe) fresh fruit, cereal, yogurts, oatmeal, and the most wonderful Belgian waffles.
