Connie, Ted, and Miriam all treated us like friends, not clients, recommending great restaurants, wineries, etc. You are on a fairly major street and there was a bit of street noise, but nothing that would prevent us from staying again..and again...and again. We went to Yountville shopping, the manager asked us where we were staying....when we said the Best Western Elm House Inn, she replied that it was the best kept secret in Napa. We would agree...pass it on! Connie and family, we hope you are wildly successful.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could this a secret, but we can't”
Reviews.Author: Zzyzx6986
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here March 7-10, for my birthday weekend. This was about our 10th trip to Napa Valley, but the first to the Elm House. We've stayed at some of the finest (read "expensive") places up there, as well as some of the not-so-finest. I waited a month to write this to make sure we still felt the same about the Elm House. We do. This place was great, especially because of the fantastic people who run it: Tom Kearns, his wife Connie, and their son Ted, along with everyone else. They could not be more accommodating. Breakfast was great, the homemade cookies at night were incredible, and the overall ambience was homey without being stifiling. They couldn't do enough to help out everyone who stayed there. It truly is an "Inn"; not a B&B, nor a motel. Our room was right above the central lobby/breakfast area. It was super clean, comfy, and pretty quiet (OK, you do hear a bit of noise in the morning with Napa traffic, but really no big deal; you're in town after all) Although we have stayed up valley and in the country as well as the city, this location was perfect: just off Hwy 29, and also just 3 minutes into downtown Napa. And the price was very reasonable, too. Would definitely stay here again, thanks mostly to Tom, et al. True Innkeepers in every sense of the word. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Napa Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: RagtopBeetle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this gem of a find for two peaceful and relaxing nights. When we return to the Wine Country of Napa, we will without a doubt, choose the Elm House Inn again for our stay. The rooms were large and comfortable, the bath and other amenities perfect, the grounds a peaceful garden setting and lastly, Tom and the rest of the the staff were very friendly, helpful and respectful. The complimentary breakfast and homemade waffles were most delicious. I will recommend this hotel to friends and family. It was like being invited into a friend's home. Having chosen this hotel from other TRIPADVISOR reviews, I can say they were right on!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best...”
Reviews.Author: trailbling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Elm House Inn back in April of 2008 and had a wonderful time. The staff and rooms were just lovely. We enjoyed the cookies that have been written about in other reviews. We found the room we were in luxurious for a Best Western and completely affordable for Napa. The staff were friendly and personable as well as just nice and helpful. That is why I recommended it to my parents for their 40th wedding anniversary this past March (2009). And that is primarily why I am writing. the Elm House Inn surpassed both my and their expectations. I called ahead of time (from my home in Raleigh, NC) to see about leaving a bottle of wine in the room for my parents, and Ted (one of the nicest hotel staff persons I've spoken with at any hotel) was very helpful in helping me pick out the right wine for my parents. He even upgraded their room and told me they'd be well taken care of for their anniversary. And they were. (As you can see, my parents don't write reviews, but for a place this exceptional, their thoughts were worth writing about.) My parents had wonderful experience. They loved the staff, the rooms, and the food. My dad is a huge fan of the mini-loaves and both loved the cookies put out for guests. They found the wine in their room, done up very nicely with two wine glasses for them to share. And the staff played up their anniversary just perfectly, enough to make them feel special and taken care, but not overbearing at all. They are already hoping to make a trip back to the inn soon with other friends. And after my own experience, and theirs, I will definitely stay at the Elm House Inn anytime I am in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good things about the Elm House Inn”
Reviews.Author: FresnoLauren5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were guests at the Elm House Inn a few weeks ago and I can say nothing but good things. In the evening, the Inn's aroma consists of delicious homemade chocolate chip cookies, which are always out for grabs and gently restocked when out. The hospitality and warm welcomes from the staff are hard to come around these days, which is why we love the Elm House Inn and are proud patrons. If you are looking for a quiet, quaint, and lovely get a away in the beautiful town of Napa, the Elm House Inn should be number one on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: zinfungirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for 2 nights and what a find !! ! we are in our 60's and enjoyed the whole experience. The staff were Wonderful. They were all very helpful and they answered all our requests promptly and with SMILES. The room we had one on the 3rd floor ( thre are elevators) was very large ,clean and lovely decorated. The atmosphere was very happy and people would sit in front of the fireplace and chat some read most enjoyed the freshly baked goodies coming from the kitchen very often.I was fortunate to sample their Chirardelli chocolate coolies WHOA! hot still... and the hot apple cider ! After a day visiting wineries( for which they gave us free coupons) we were appy to relax and that was the place to do it. I would recomend this place for anyone who wants to be pampered. One thing I must suggest, is that you take a tiny trip about 20 miles away and visit the Old Faithful of Calistoga, a GEYSER yes ! !! wonderful . Nicole and Gino Ottawa Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but not quiet”
Reviews.Author: TravelYoda
Reviews.Content: High ratings for ambiance, service and interior. Staff was very pleasant and service outstanding. Unfortunately, we found the room to be very noisy through the night. The combination of the loud heater fan, the outside traffic noise, and the odd sound of a washing machine near the exterior wall made it very difficult to sleep. The noise factor is why I can only give it three stars. Also the street location is not in a picturesque part of town, nor is there any nearby services to walk to. Next time visiting Napa Valley I will look for a place farther North and out of the city of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: darknstormy
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel from all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and we can only echo what everyone else has said. It was the perfect stay. Large, clean rooms, great breakfast, helpful friendly staff and a not bad location to explore beautiful Napa Valley from. If I ever go back, I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: aehall
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were a little nervous as the hotel itself didn't look like anything special. But when we entered we were pleasantly surprised. The fireplace was going, there were orchids everywhere. It was a rather small main area but so beatiful and relaxing. The girl who helped us was very friendly. She was going to put us in a room next to the stairs so we asked to be a bit farther away and without hesitation, she upgraded us to another room away from the lobby area. The rooms were very nice. Spacious, clean, very comfortable. The next morning we woke up to the smell of fresh belgian waffles. They were so yummy. There was also fresh oj, yogurt parfait., muffins, toast; quite a selection of great food. The gentleman who helped us the next morning was also very friendly. Parking was free and there was plenty of it. The location was right off the main hwy and the beginning of Napa so we were happy with the location. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Trust Me...”
Reviews.Author: Fritz59
Reviews.Content: Well, having had some luck with the reviews here on Trip Advisor I went looking for a nice place to stay in Napa for a night that wouldn't break the bank and on the other hand wouldn't be creepy, disgusting, or dirty. This place got really good reviews, so I took the leap of faith and jumped. What a deal! This "Best Western" stands head and shoulders above any Best Western I've ever stayed in before. It was, as someone else described it, more like a boutique hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and cooperative. The room interior was beautiful and the room compared favorably in appointments and cleanliness with the Fairmont in downtown San Francisco (where we stayed the next night) (OK, we really splurged for one night). The foyer and sitting area were truly nice--fireplace, comfy sofas and ottomans and all. The continental breakfast was not the typical crinkly old bananas and dried cereal--instead a nice, but not extravagant, spread (let's put it this way--it was better than the Fairmont's breakfast buffet ($75 for two) and it didn't cost a cent extra). All for about $110 for one night. All in all, this is DEFINITELY a place I'll stay again. While we were "off-season" in the wine country, and it wasn't crowded at all-- I'd still chance it any time of the year. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “You cant have a bad time here!”
Reviews.Author: The_Lost_Beaver
Reviews.Content: If you want a great B and B which you want to want to have a relaxing base to explore Napa valley then just book this one! The hotel rooms themselves are good. Big rooms, table and chairs, nice bathroom, free parking and a separate hand basin outside the bathroom is a nice touch. However its the staff, food and main hotel lobby/ living room is where the hotel exceeds all expectations. The hotel manager Tom couldnt be any more helpful. He booked us takeaway on the first night, recommended where we could get some wine before showing us some good areas the next day we could visit in the valley. The hotel living room has a huge open fire and some relaxing sofa and chairs in front to relax to. The home made cookies and warm cider is a lovely touch and taste even better. The breakfast was brilliant aswell- setting you up for the day. Everyone else in the hotel seemed very happy with this place aswell which meant the whole place came across as a lovely relaxed place to stay. If you want 5 star rooms and a spa then stay (and pay pay more) somewhere else. If you want a great relaxing stay that leaves you with a smile on your face stay here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best, if not, the best”
Reviews.Author: mdrodrigues
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awesome. As someone else wrote, forget everything that comes to mind when you think of Best Western. This place is so great and Connie makes sure you are well taken care of. This is the only place we will stay when we go to Napa now, assuming we can get a room! Apparently the secret is out about this place so book early! Just an awesome, cozy place with great service.

Reviews.Title: “The Way it Should Be”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Crackers
Reviews.Content: Nice large room with fireplace, extraordinary. Wonderful breakfast in the atrium, waffles made fresh. No penny-nickel-diming and free WiFi. Bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on. Nice people who run the place. I wish other places were like this, I really appreciated their attention to details and customer service/anticipation. Location is very convenient for outlet shopping and wine country access, and no issues parking. I'm glad we stayed here. Actually, I'm tempted to keep this place a secret, but I also like to support things that are well done like this.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful innkeepers--ever! And an outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: Thelonious_G
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Elm House Inn for 3 nights. The hotel is run by a married couple and their grown son. All three of them were outstandingly helpful in giving us advice about where to stay and what to do while we were there. The breakfasts were excellent with both healthy and indulgent options. An outstanding value, more like staying in a boutique hotel than a typical Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic trip!!”
Reviews.Author: mtngirlnv
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a rainy Saturday afternoon for a birthday getaway and fell in love with our fireplace room. It was large enough to handle all of our luggage and over the next few days, all of the wine we bought. The breakfast downstairs was fresh and the variety of baked goods, hot and cold cereal along with the freshly made waffles was outstanding. We had asked for a recommendation for a driver to take us to various wineries and got a winner in Kevin, who took us to some off-the-beaten path places. We are already planning our trip next year!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly family owned establishment”
Reviews.Author: LibraGalSingapore
Reviews.Content: A cosy, family managed hotel that is a value for money. Connie, who greeted us upon arrival was nothing but friendly throughout our stay. The hot cider and freshly baked cookies were to die for!!!!!!!!!! The rooms were big enough for 4 people (2 adults & 2 teenagers) and the beds were soft and comfortable. A wide spread of items were available for breakfast; and the waffles come highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wine tasting in Napa”
Reviews.Author: dozer037
Reviews.Content: Nothing but perfect! Nice room, immaculate! Great, friendly staff. Excellent breakfast. Like a bed and breakfast with fresh baked cookies and hot cider at 6. The price is very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the Valley”
Reviews.Author: KingsvilleTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this inn for four nights while visiting Napa Valley. Our friends, with whom we travelled, booked the hotel. Initially, when I heard that we were booked at a Best Western, I was a little disappointed because I was hoping for a smaller, more romantic sort of inn. What a pleasant surprise! This inn was truly run as an "inn." The proprietors were a visible presence and the inn reflected their warm, kind, personalites. The inn was clean, comfortable, and very homey. The breakfast was amazing - not your average hotel breakfast by any stretch. Homemade waffles, fruit breads, and other wonderful items. The hot cider and cookies each night were another personal touch by the innkeepers, and a pleasant surprise and treat. The innkeepers did everything they could - went above and beyond - to make our stay memorable and comfortable. We will stay at this inn again on our next trip to the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “More like a country Inn!”
Reviews.Author: chatkatter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful trip to Wine Country in California. I did a lot of research before booking Trip Advisor's "most popular place to stay in Napa." It is called The Best Western Elm House Inn! It had excellent reviews and was moderately priced. Ignore the fact that this property is a Best Western and stay in one of the nicest little hotels that you have ever stayed in. My husband travels for a living and he never likes hotel rooms, but he was thrilled with our spacious, comfortable king sized deluxe room and did not want to leave! When we arrived at 9:30 in the evening, there was a fire going and there were complimentary fresh baked chocolate chip cookies as well as a decanter of dessert wine available. The very helpful person on duty showed us to our wonderful HUGE room and then found us a restaurant that was still open. The next morning we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast with delicious homemade muffins right out of the oven, as well as fruit, yogurt , hot waffles etc. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful and the owner was absolutely delightful. She obviously loved her hotel and it really showed! She even packed us some of their famous cookies for the trip home! We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone watching their travel budget ( and who isn't these days?) as it is truly a gem and an unbelievable value! We will not hesitate to stay there on our next visit to Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Like A Country Inn”
Reviews.Author: gilmoreooa
Reviews.Content: What a special place. Small, intimate with incredibly attentive hosts. Fresh made waffles and baked goods in the morning, homemade cookies in the evening. We used this as our base to explore Napa and Sonoma wineries for three days. Our room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. The outdoor patio was a great place to share some wine after an exhausting day of tastings. The only con I can think of might be to avoid the rooms next to the breakfast room, they might be a bit noisy in the morning. Having said that I noticed that guests in those rooms seemed to enjoy sneaking out to take their favorite baked good and a cup of coffee back to their rooms for breakfast. We would stay there again in a heart beat. Illinois Travelers

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Arewethereyet?SF
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews, we were confident this would be a good choice. I guess we (2 couples) should have been forewarned when we were told we would have to change rooms during our 2 night stay. The reservation was booked 4 weeks in advance directly with the hotel and while we never did get a satisfactory explaination why we had to move, (we had king beds both nights) the owner assured us he would discount our rate for our inconvienience. That "discounted rate" turned out to be $309 incl. tax In my experience, that doesn't qualify as a discounted rate unless I'm staying at a Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Living in the San Francisco Bay Area, I get that October is high season in the Napa Valley, but really, we're talking about a Best Western here. The room sizes are all over the place; large, small and smaller but the rates don't seem to reflect this. Some have 2 sinks, a pedestal sink in the bathroom and another in the closet. Yes, it's odd, but nice to have the second sink. Some fireplaces, others not. We actually experienced all of the above in our 2 night stay. Pillows were flat and in one of the rooms we stayed, the pillow case had make up stains and the comforter was dirty. Breakfast was OK but the seating area is very limited, so on both days people were standing around holding cereal bowls looking for places to sit. They have one table outside, but it was 52 degrees and no space heater. Room amenties are the standard Best Western issue, so bring your own. The hotel is situated on a very busy street, so there is road noise and dependant where your room is located it can be an issue. Aside from the dirty comforter and pillow case, you can overlook the other issues if the price is right, but not for $309.00. There are far better places to stay in the Napa Valley for the same rate and with better locations. Book early at one of those and avoid the Elm House.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful inn!”
Reviews.Author: GJEColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House for three nights in early October based on reviews and we were very pleased. The staff set the tone for a wonderful stay - they accomodated our every request and really seemed to enjoy their guests. This was our first stay (hopefully not our last) and did get 'stuck' with the room near the elevator off the lobby. We rarely heard the elevator, and while we did hear diners while we were still in bed, the noise was not loud enough to wake us up. The lobby area was warm and friendly, and like everyone else we really enjoyed the breakfast and evening cookies. This may not be a great place for small children, but it is a welcome retreat for adults!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: DiveInHeels
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by this cute little Inn. What a find! Do not let the fact that it is a Best Western disuade you. It is more of a larger bed and breakfast and you would never know it is a Best Western. The Innkeepers could not be more helpful or pleasant. We did not arrive until 12:30am and the Innkeeper was waiting for us with a plate full of the most delicious homemade cookies and a smile. I would recommemd a room on the 2nd floor as some rooms are right off the fireside breakfast area and look like sound could be an issue. You are also in walking distance to downtown Napa for a leisurely stroll to and from dinner. Breakfast has something for everyone including fresh baked goods. You truly cannot beat the price for such a clean, comfortable, convienient, and adorable Inn. If you are a runner, contact Napa Running Company and they are more than helpful in helping you plan your routes in Napa. If you need a gym, there is a fitness center 1 mile away...note it is a gym and definately not a health club!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but.........”
Reviews.Author: Markhan
Reviews.Content: I am actually writing this from room 203 of this hotel and I have just one question for all the previous reviewers, are you all deaf or do you carry ear plugs everywhere with you !. The traffic noise at this place is horrendous and this particular room is right next to the lift. Don't get me wrong, the place room is very nice and the whole place is immaculate but what is the point if you can't get a good nights sleep?. We have one more night here so it's off to buy some ear plugs today so we can get a good nights sleep before we move on tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Not your Father's Best Western”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeAlum
Reviews.Content: 3 couples descended on Napa for Labor Day weekend and we stayed at the Elm House... in one word, it was "perfect". I researched where to stay on Trip Advisor and decided to take a chance here after reading the reviews. I will just reiterate what others have said, recommend you get out of bed for the waffles, and let you know that you can't go wrong with this lodging choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with a great personal touch”
Reviews.Author: AbiV
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in Napa for one night, much to my regret now, because the town and surrounding vineyards are just beautiful and incredibly peaceful and relaxing. And when I return, I wouldn't hesitate to book at the Elm House Inn again. It's a fairly small hotel - I'd guess at 10 to 15 rooms - with no dining or bar facilities, however this was more than compensated by good sized rooms, a beautiful lounge area and a great outdoor spa pool. The additional little touches, like a complimentary evening glass of sherry and the best "melt in your mouth" freshly baked chocolate chip cookies I have ever tasted, made this feel really special. The breakfast (also complimentary) was great, with huge freshly made waffles and syrup on offer, as well as cereal, fruit, yoghurt, toast etc. Very friendly staff and great value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: MRW901
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation in California last week and spent the last two days of our trip in Napa Valley. We stayed at the Best Western Elm House Inn and it definitely exceeded our expectations. We were worried about checking in too late on Saturday because we had gotten caught up with a full day of wine tastings, but we called ahead and they said it would be no problem. When we got there, we were greeted by Tom who was extremely helpful and accommodating. Once we saw our room, we were both happily surprised to see how nice it was! We especially liked having the separate bathroom/vanity areas! The linens were so soft and comfy! And we definitely took advantage of the air conditioning, since the previous hotel we had stayed at on our trip had no air. There was a very nice sized hot tub in the back of the hotel, which we didn't have time to take advantage of. We only ate breakfast at the hotel one morning, which was included with our stay. It was very nice and staff were extremely friendly. We also LOVED the cookies that were put out each night, they were delicious. My husband and I loved this hotel, it had a very homey feeling, almost like a bed and breakfast. We would certainly come back here when we plan to visit Napa again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Napa's best”
Reviews.Author: lancet72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this property a year ago in May and liked it so much, that when we went to Napa this time there was no question about where to stay. We have booked on the Best Western Site and wrote to the hotel directly to let them know it was a return visit and a special occasion. Terry immediately responded with a request to upgrade us to a premium room which we gladly accepted. We were given room 405 in the new building and were treated as personally and warmly as the year before. It is not a very fancy hotel, but it's full of character, clean, perfectly located and the staff are superb. The Belgian waffles for breakfast, cookies and wine tastings in the afternoon are a great treat. We will not think twice about staying there again while in Napa and neither should you :-) Anat and Alex

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Evie374
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Best Western. Like other reviewers it felt more like a large B & B. We stayed here for 3 nights and I booked my room very far in advance and got a great rate of 144 a night for a very large room with a King Size Bed. Lots of space in room and had two sinks in different areas of the room. The staff was very friendly and helpfuly. The breakfast in the morning had everything I need to eat to start my day. Homemade waffles and homemade banana, lemon poppy and coffe cakes. Fresh Fruit, oatmeal, cereal etc... Evening the had dessert wine and homemade cookies. It was easy to get to the surrounding towns by car. I would stay here again my next trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely inn”
Reviews.Author: buckysmom
Reviews.Content: Great place in Napa. Free breakfast and wi-fi; nice staff; Recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Great Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: buttonhead
Reviews.Content: This is not your usual Best Western....it REALLY is a small Inn. Napa is not an inexpensive place to hang out --- I was a little surprised at the price we paid for a Best Western stay, but as mentioned, it was not the typical B.W. It's a cozy place, with a really sweet back courtyard, next to the hot tub. Very restful place to sit quietly for a quick break. At the front desk, Seth was welcoming and helpful...right when we checked in, he asked about our dinner thoughts, and immediately placed a reservation call for us. Our room was LARGE....it was also nice to have two separate sink areas.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: Annos
Reviews.Content: After having just stayed at another Best Western, our expectations were low. What a pleasant suprise when we checked in to the BW Elm House Inn. It was more like a B&B. According to the manager, it had been built in the 1980"s as a hotel. The rooms were beautiful, and the breakfast was the best. Made to order waffles, fruit, oatmeal, freshly baked banana breads and more. The manager helped wait tables. They even had a computer that you could use to get on the Internet. You could eat in the dining area or outside on the patio. There was a sofa and chairs in front of an inviting fireplace. It was one of the best hotels on our trip. I would recommend it to anyone. Not your usual Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Perfect for Napa!!”
Reviews.Author: Umanskys
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an amazing stay in Napa Valley which was made even better by our time at the Elm House Inn. This place is heaven. The entire hotel is run by a very family like staff who are very polite and helpful. Every monring you smell fresh baked goods and breads! The fresh made waffles for breakfast every morning are great along with the banana bread. The people who work at the counter are a wealth of knowledge regarding dining and activities to do. Every night we did not know where to eat or what to do they not only came up with the perfect suggestions, but also booked reservations for us. To top it all off, every night they baked fresh cookies which were the most amazing treats. They then put these fresh baked cookies out with milk and free port wine. It was heaven after coming back from a long day in wine county!! By the end of our couple day stay, the owners even knew us by name. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel because the service is amazing and the cost is extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: LotterdaleLady
Reviews.Content: August 12, 2008 Congratulations to Tom Kearns, Innkeeper, and his staff for creating a great little hotel with the B & B feel. Rooms are nice, garden and courtyard are pleasant and the breakfast was good. I highly reccomend this litttle jewel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: bob8892
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay in traditional bed-and-breakfast inns when visiting the Wine Country. We were a bit skeptical about staying in a "Best Western" this time. We were very pleasantly surprised. Connie and Tom Kearns are delightful hosts. Very attentive to their guests. The hotel, while certainly bigger than a b-n-b, still offered the personal attention you'd expect. Rooms were fairly typical of Best Western, meaning they were comfortable, clean, and reasonably well equipped. A lovely sitting area in the lobby, with fresh-baked cookies and port available in the evening. Breakfast was quite nice. Freshly made waffles a very nice touch, and the staff was terrific. The location of the property is extremely convenient if you want to explore the Napa Valley. Just blocks from both the main road up to Calistoga, and the well-known Silverado Trail. And just a few blocks from downtown Napa. Overall, a great value, and terrific base of operations for exploring this part of the Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “can't be faulted”
Reviews.Author: cantrillo
Reviews.Content: We were on a five week tour of the Western US and had stayed in 10 other hotels......a really mixed bag in terms of quality. We could not find fault with this hotel. It is impossible to over praise it. Everything about it was brilliant,......the staff, the room, the in-room facilities, the breakfast, the complimentary port (and home made cookies) each evening. Just before this we had stayed in a 'luxury' hotel in Las vegas.....it couldn't even come close to this! A well deserved number 1 spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: aonu99
Reviews.Content: Only in Napa for one night and wanted a "bed and breakfast" experience. I read the reviews here on tripadvisor and decided to book at the best western elm house. The staff was very friendly and customer service focused and the rooms were clean. Breakfast next morning was excellent. I would recommend this place for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Waffles but Roosters can way youup”
Reviews.Author: WATCHFULEYESTODAY
Reviews.Content: Ww stayed there for 3 nights. Very good stay; enjoyed Banana Braed, Waffles and Cookies; the breakast otherwise was average; Our friends has cotton balls in their ears to block the noise from the Roosters at night they were on the southside - we were are the Northside and we did not hear the roosters. Very friendly staff. Mixed use area residental/commerical neighborhood -across the street is construction storage/staging area. 5 - 10 Minutes from downtown Napa - to far to walk to. Overall nice Small Hotel - clean rooms; but dated. Enjoyed the small garden on property. The rooms are the lower 1st floor can be with noise and can smell of breakfast in the morning; if you are a late sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: aec143
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel, it felt more like a B&B than a Best Western. The room was a nice size, comfortable and had a fireplace. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast didn't offer a huge variety, but the waffles, hard boiled eggs and coffee were plenty for me. The hotel had a cute courtyard that was really relaxing when my husband and I came back from a long day of "winery"ing. My only issue was that the location was about a mile from downtown Napa, but was a block away from the huge Embassy Suites (where we were attending a wedding). I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: UKUK-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure how this has made it to be number 1 in the ratings for Napa. We stayed in a room just off the main reception area....which was odd! As there were 3 in our room a rollaway was just left for us to set up but as we had just flown over 10 hours plus negiotated San Francisco's rush hour traffic we were all feeling rather jaded by the time we had got to the hotel. We had to totally redesign the room to accomodate the rollaway bed, something I believe should have already been done for us. Breakfasts were OK, apart from the waffles everything else was pretty average. The wine that was served in the evening was like vinegar, which was a shame when we were supposed to be in a major wine area! Not an exciting location so all in all extremely average...

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars for Me”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with a beautiful garden around the whirlpool. It is has great access to Napa and the wineries, but is in a residential neighborhood, rather than near the bars and restaurants in Napa. Napa is expensive, but I felt that this hotel was an alright value at $252 per night during the busy summer season. Breakfast was great and the staff was very helpful. We had a deluxe king room in the annex building and it was quite spacious with two comfy chairs and an ottoman. While I might look for a better deal in Napa, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: kernzerly
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded us of a European feel. The tour recommendations were excellent. Our room was spacious and very clean. It was one of the better overnight experiences we've had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Attention To Detail”
Reviews.Author: Giantsfan24
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with open arms the second we entered the little gem of the wine country. The lobby smelled of freshly baked cookies (Which turned out to be THE best cookies I have ever tasted, even better then my mothers famous recipe) which added to the cozy, relaxing ambience of the hotel. The Inn Keeper Tom was engaging and knowledgeable of the entire Napa Valley. By the time we departed he felt like an old friend to us. I judge my hotel stay's by the staff's attention to detail. Our room was located on the first floor. At first judging by the previous couple reviews I was a bit skeptical. Our room was immaculate and charming. We had absolutely no problems with noise. Once our door was closed we might as well have been in the farthest corner of the hotel. Each morning we were awaken by the aroma of fresh waffles which got me out of bed earlier than usual because my stomach would not let me go back to sleep. Our breakfast was served by the other Inn Keeper Connie (whom I later found out was the magician behind the world's best cookies) served us made to order waffles accompanied by fresh fruit and oatmeal with all the proper trimmings. We spent our day's touring wineries and the evenings enjoying a bottle of wine in the hot tub situated in the charming garden behind the hotel. Tom and Connie recommended some of the best restaurants we have enjoyed in a long time. Each of there recommendations fulfilled everything we were looking for. Again back to details, Connie was aware of my love for her cookies so upon our return she had set aside 2 cookies and some ice cold milk for me and my fiancÃ© to enjoy upon our return from dinner. Leaving this place was like awakening from a wonderful dream. Every detail of our stay was perfect from the moment we opened the lobby door to the unfortunate moment the hotel disappeared in our rearview mirror. We left relaxed and completely satisfied. Tom and Connie thank you so much for the treatment you extended to me and my fiancÃ©. We are both grateful, and cannot wait to return to the smell of freshly baked cookies at The Elm House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Three Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GoIlliniMom
Reviews.Content: We were at the Elm House June 27-29 for our 25th wedding anniversary and really enjoyed our stay at this quaint and cozy hotel. We felt that the breakfast each morning of waffles, yogurt, and cereals was very good. We looked forward to the delicious cookies each evening, too. The landscaping around the place is wonderful. It is in a busy location, but we found it convenient to get on Highway 29. Our room was in the outer building on the 2nd floor (#403) and it was very spacious. The staff and innkeepers were all very friendly. They recommended restaurants and a winery tour company with which we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MooseJoh
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, wonderful cookies, very good breakfasts. Friendly and very professional staff. This hotel is conveniently placed near the highway (and the winery zones) but enough far to be very quiet . We stayed for two nights and we really enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and large. The next time we go to Napa we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lowlight of the holiday”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn08
Reviews.Content: We booked the elm house after reading the excellent reviews on trip advisor, unfortunately as we parked our car outside before check in ,we noticed the very noisy a/c. The first thing we said to the male on reception was that we didnt want that room. He informed us that was the only one available as it was the nascar weekend , it was on the ground floor and led directly out to the kitchen and dining area. We were also told that the rates were higher for the nascar weekend but they were doing us a favour by keeping the price at the quote we had received on booking ! The room had a stale smell and looked as if it needed a good makeover. We did not enjoy our stay here, we felt as we were from europe that they stuck us in that room . The next morning we were woken by the diners outside our bedroom door having their breakfast. Elm house was the lowlight of an otherwise wonderful holiday to California , never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JulieAMarietta_GA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Best Western Elm House in Napa, CA. I picked this hotel mainly because of the excellent reviews it received on this website and because of the moderate cost for that area. While it is a Best Western, it is really more a Bed & Breakfast. Very nice property right in town and convenient to most everything. They do not have a pool, however, they do have a nice hot tub (we didn't use it because it was very warm while we were there). We had plenty of room, it was very clean and the breakfast was delicious - the freshly made Belgian waffles were wonderful. They also put out freshly baked cookies and sherry each evening which we really looked forward to. If you don't want a large resort with a spa, but are looking for a nice place to stay in Napa, you can't go wrong with the Elm House.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience in Napa”
Reviews.Author: CheckMan
Reviews.Content: We had two nights to stay in Napa after a long drive down the Pacific Coast Highway from Seattle, WA, so I did some research on TripAdvisor and found the listing for the BW Elm House Inn. Since most of the other places in the area were significantly more expensive, I chose the Elm House Inn and booked it over the BW website, using my AAA membership for a discount for a room with two queen beds for myself, my wife and two daughters. The traffic layout for that area of Napa is a bit weird, but after having to make a couple of turns, we got back to the Elm House and checked in. The young man at the desk was very pleasant and helpful. We got a third floor room and found it to be quite clear and well furnished. The only problem we ran into with the room and the Inn as a whole was that it was quite warm. Part of that may be that we'd come from very cool and rainy weather from the Oregon coast through most of the Northern California coast, but we're Northern Floridians and used to heat, so I suspect that the owners may have had the thermostats "up" a bit to keep their costs down. The A/C in our room did cool things off a bit, but we found at night (since I was closest to it, I'm the one who had to deal with it!) that it simply would run for a time, then cut off, while the room was stil rather warm. I opened the window, hoping that the cooler air would help, but the traffic noises only managed to keep me awake. Additionally, the comforters on the beds are incredibly thick, adding to the problem. Breakfast in the mornings in the common area on the first floor was very nice and the service was excellent. Yes, they pretty much have the same kind of stuff as a regular BW might have on the road, but it is served and plated much differently. Additionally, the owners fresh bake pasteries and breads and have them on the table, which makes a big difference as well. It was by far the best breakfast experience I've had at a BW or other major chain hotel in quite a while. One review posted recently referred to the rather "questionable" nature of the surrounding neighborhood. Well, it isn't exactly downtown Napa or Sonoma, but we never felt threatened, even when I took a wrong turn and found myself in the "lower rent" district of town where the folks are the "help" in the vineyards, restaurants and shops of the area. Besides, had the Elm House Inn been in a "better" neighborhood" it probably would have been much more expensive. It certainly didn't bother us. It is quite easy to get around from the Elm House Inn to other sights in the area and they are quite good about telling you or even arranging a custom tour for you should you ask to some of the vineyards. My only other complaint about the Elm House was the laundry facilities (such as they are). The sole washing machine and dryer are located outside the Inn through a door to the outside of the Inn that is still covered by a fence. Both machines require ridiculous amounts of change to operate. I though this was a rather tacky addition--though perhaps they do it because of the cost of water in the Napa Valley (I'm trying to be generous). We enjoyed our stay at the Elm House--my two complaints about the temperature and laundry facilities notwithstanding. We got to meet guests from Australia and England because of the breakfast/lobby common area and found everyone to be quite pleasant. We'd have no problem returning there someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great breakfast, bad location”
Reviews.Author: MrsClean76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a 20th anniversary trip to San Francisco & Napa Valley. The hotel is nice for a Best Western, but was not the romantic Napa getaway we had hoped for. The place is located on a very busy street, in somewhat of a questionable residential neighborhood. Both mornings we were woken up by a rooster crowing in a house across the street (between 4:30-5:00am!). The deluxe building we were in was better than the main building. I felt sorry for the folks stuck in rooms right next to the breakfast buffet. The deluxe rooms are nicer than your average Best Western, with lots of pillows, pillow top mattress, mini fridge, and one robe. Our internet worked fine. The windows had sheer drapes and window treatments, but no blackout shades. The air conditioner was extremely loud as other reviews noted. The noise from the A/C didn't drown out the street noise or rooster though. The breakfast was excellent, with waffles cooked to order, and staff available to clear tables, bring coffee, etc. In the evening, there were fresh baked cookies, although they were all gone the first night we stayed. It was ok, and you'll probably love it if you are in the gray-haired crowd, but next time we will look for something in a nicer neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: luckygreeneyedlady
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in the Napa area with 3 other couples and booked this hotel without know what to expect. All 4 couples were completely satisfied and loved our rooms. We didn't know what to expect when we saw the place was right in the town, but it was more than we could have asked for. They recommended a restaurant for us to walk to. There is a lovely patio and hot tub in the back which makes you feel you are in the country. The breakfast in the morning was amazing and we all left full and happy!

Reviews.Title: “Connie rocks!”
Reviews.Author: McCannfam
Reviews.Content: Connie is absolutely wonderful, as are all of the employees who work there. Very kind, polite and make you feel very welcome. My family stayed here for 2 nights and were more than comfortable. Connie was very open to any suggestions we might have had, not to mention makes some of the best cookies I have ever tasted. Definitely not what you would expect from a Best Western. Anytime I go to Napa, this will be my #1 choice. Thanks for everything Connie! McCann family

Reviews.Title: “"You had me at hello"”
Reviews.Author: NYCupcake
Reviews.Content: We walked in and the smell of cookies baking set the perfect tone for our stay. The place is wonderful and is more like a B&B than a chain hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were large and clean. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: evieroselily
Reviews.Content: I was a travel agent in my previous life & the Elm House Inn, in my experience is outstanding. The staff are very welcoming & friendly & know what customer service is all about. The owner is a mine of information when it comes to suggestions for wine tasting & all the places he recommended were just great. We stayed in a room in the annexe which was very big, nicely decorated & very clean. I would strongly recommend that you ask for one of these rooms. The hotel has a terrace at the back which is enclosed & has the most delightful little garden with a hot tub as well. The fresh waffles at breakfast are made to order & are simply delicious as are the freshly baked cookies at tea time. Nothing seems to be too much trouble & it comes as a surprise that it is part of the Best Western chain because the owners seem to run it as though you are guests in their home. It is the first time we have stayed in the Napa Valley & would definitely come back again to stay at the Elm House Inn. I feel, it is most suitable for couples & singles but not for young families . My husband & I could find no fault & to sum it up I would rate this hotel as a 'little gem'!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and will return again”
Reviews.Author: cowboysteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed two night and enjoyed our stay!!!! I don't think you could find a better value than this. You will find many glowing report about the Elm House Inn, PLEASE believe them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique Best Western”
Reviews.Author: hmorgan13
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place! The Elm House was cozy, clean, and had a fabulous breakfast included in the price. It was more like being at a B&B than a hotel. Breakfast included fresh-baked rolls and breads, and the delicious belgian waffles. The innkeepers were very friendly and helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Room makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: Madison90
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, they check us in to room 106, this room was right by the kitchen and was small. With one request, they allowed us to move to room 405 which is in the new section of the hotel and a GREAT room. Made all the difference. Staying in room 405 I give the place 4 stars because the price waas right and the room was really very nice. YOu would expect to pay a lot more for that room in this location. Very close to downtown Napa and the highway. Staff was very nice. I would recommend staying here, but do not take room 105 or 106.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else again!”
Reviews.Author: PennyandLeo
Reviews.Content: We'd been to Napa previously and stayed at the River Terrace Inn, which was also great. But we were able to get rooms at the Elm House Inn this time and boy, am I glad! This place is fantastic. Cute and quaint like a bed and breakfast, but with none of the creepy, in-your-business attitude. The breakfasts were amazing - I am still dreaming about the waffles - and the afternoon cookies were SO good. Every member of the staff was incredibly nice and helpful. The rooms were large and clean, beds comfy, and the gardens.....well, we live in the city of Chicago and I'm not used to seeing that much greenery so I was blown away. They seriously have the most gorgeous roses I've ever seen. I LOVE this place - would recommend it to anyone and when we return to Napa, we will definitely be booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Duberto
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid that I won't be adding anything too original to what you've read in other reviews - but, as a matter of fact, that's a good thing: the Best Western Elm House Inn is exactly as described in the vast majority of reviews! Tom and Connie (and Seth and the others who keep the place running) are warm, friendly, knowledgeable about what the area (not just Napa, but also Calistoga, etc.) has to offer, and run the Elm House Inn with fine attention to detail. The breakfast is a great way to start one's holiday/touring day and the cookies certainly add a nice, warm touch to the tail end! The only caveat I would add (again, not a particularly original one) is that if you're looking for a "Tuscany in the Napa Valley" experience (i.e., picturesque inn surrounded by vineyards with mountains in the background) this is a little bit off from that - although very close to the growing charms that Napa (city) provides (e.g., The Bounty Hunter, ZuZu). But, really, it's only about 15-20 minutes drive (at most) away from the heart of wine country - and the pluses far outweigh any possible minuses: the Elm House Inn and its rooms are quite nice, the staff is truly there to make life comfortable, and the prices are rather fair. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: pattycakesflorida
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on it's #1 rating for Napa and were not disappointed! Everything about our stay was positive--from the spacious room to the delicious breakfast provided by the wonderful innkeepers! We certainly hope to stay here again and will recommend this location to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “We Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: TemeculaBonbon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Napa and we stayed here and had a wonderful stay. This place was so nice, from the moment we stepped in the door they were there offering service. Making dinner reservations for us and hot cookies and cider , coffee or tea. Everyone we saw who worked there was so nice. And you could see how nice and kind they were to each other as well. The place was very clean fresh roses everywhere. Our room was nice on the 3rd floor in the main building. You could smell breakfast in the morning. Which by the way was very good..... Overall we had a great stay this is where I plan to stay from now on when I visit.. And I am very picky when it come to hotels. I don't just stay anywhere... It has to be NICE and very CLEAN for me. So if thats what your looking for this place is it......

Reviews.Title: “Motel meets B&B with great hosts”
Reviews.Author: BatesyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This place is a great find. We arrived after a 14 hour flight from Sydney and a drive from San Francisco and felt immediately relaxed. I indulged in the cookies that Connie offered me straight from the oven. Tom & Connie are really nice people and run a modern, clean and stylish motel that has all modern comforts plus the feel of a B&B. Good location and easy parking. Breakfast is great, much better than a standard continental. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is your Place to Stay in the Valley !”
Reviews.Author: Misscoco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elm House for New Yearâ€™s Eve and we can assure you, you would never know this was a Best Western. We had a such a great experience which just enhanced our Napa / Sonoma tour !!! Connie and Tom are the owners of this hotel which we feel is definitely more of a Bed and Breakfast. The staff is very friendly and is always ready to help you especially on recommendations on what to do in the area. On New Yearâ€™s Eve, there was complimentary champagne in the living area and Connie made freshly baked goodies to add to the celebration. In addition to their breakfast, Connie comes around to the different tables with assorted delectables that she created that morning. She also tries to accommodate special dietary restrictions if needed. We canâ€™t say enough about this hotel. For the price - this is your place to stay while visiting Napa and Sonoma.! Corinne and Roger

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: mshackey
Reviews.Content: We loved the Best Western Elm House Inn. We chose this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. We had room 207 with both a fireplace and a Jacuzzi tub. It was an extremely relaxing and romantic get-a-way! Tom and Connie were truly delightful. Always available to help! Connie even put together a tray, complete with fresh flowers, for my husband to bring me breakfast in bed one morning! After sleeping through our dinner reservation one night, Tom ordered us pizza and had it delivered to our room along with water, plates and napkins! The hospitality was perfect and only added to our memorable trip! The location is very convenient and parking was a breeze. We can not wait to return to the Elm House Inn and will recommend it to anyone heading to Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “Try to book this one well ahead of your trip”
Reviews.Author: bryantl
Reviews.Content: The Elm House is classy and beautiful. It's like staying in an old wonderful house from 100 years ago, but has all the modern amenities. Everyone there is lovely and eager to give you info on the wineries and other attractions. The beds are great and the bath products are premium. The breakfast is sumptuous. I only regret we only stayed one night. It was one of the highlights of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Two Years in a Row”
Reviews.Author: Scooterv
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong staying here if you are visiting the city of Napa. The location is excellent, close to the highway, just as close to the city proper and good restaurants. They serve a dependable breakfast, good directions, and even better recommendations for dinner. The bed could be more comfortable, but you cannot have everything. It has got to be the best bang for the buck in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: dglee
Reviews.Content: We chose the Elm House based on previous trip advisor reviews.....and they were spot on about how fabulous the hotel is. We did a 2 week whistle stop tour of central California and this was my favourite hotel. Service is brilliant; really warm and welcoming without being contrived and fake. Breakfast was a lovely surprise as it was more than the bog standard cereal and toast. Even the coffee came with take-out disposable cups in case anyone wanted to take one away with them after breakfast! Internet was free (as well as use of the printer - how great is that!). We stayed in one of the second floor rooms which I would definitely recommend and avoid room # 104, 105 (as the room walks out into the breakfast/living room area - we saw a few bleary eyed guests coming out of their room for breakfast!).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1stgradetraveler
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Napa in March 2008 and enjoyed our stay. As most others have said, this does not feel like a typical Best Western- more like a B&B. The room was basic, but nice- 2 sinks, including one outside the bathroom, which was nice for the extra space. The living room area is very nice- fireplace with couch and tables. The inn has a large binder with restaurant menus and the staff helped us to select an excellent restaurant for dinner (Ubunto, in Napa) and made reservations. They also have coupons for wineries in the area. Board games available in the living room were nice after the wineries closed, before dinner. Breakfast is very nice- lots of fresh fruit, and, as others have mentioned, good oatmeal toppings and waffles. Warm cookies in the afternoon were a nice touch as well- while we were playing Monopoly one late afternoon, every guest that returned from their day checked for cookies! Location is good- just off 29 and a few minutes drive to downtown Napa. Overall, we had a very nice stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: LBlank-SalinasCA
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed in Napa before, I was a little wary of a Best Western, especially in view of all the great properties from Napa to Calistoga, But, hey, the price was right. It turns out that the value was even better! Boy, was I in for a surprise. Elm House was definitely more a B&B than a cookie cutter motel/hotel. Tom and Connie were terrific hosts - cordial, caring, helpful, and friendly - always available without being pests. The facility was warm, comfortable, and cozy. Parking was very handy. The fireplace was warm and inviting, the perfect place to read the morning newspaper or a favorite book in the afternoon while enjoying hot cider and homemade chocolate chip cookies. The patio and garden are a testiment to Connie's green thumb! And breakfast -- NOT the standard continental breakfast -- the perfect way to start the morning. Coffee, tea, milk, juice; oatmeal with toppings; hard boiled eggs; bagels; cereal; and the best Belgian waffles this side of Brussels! The room we enjoyed (304) had all the amenities we needed or desired. Very clean, everything worked, bathroom spotless, airy window looking north, and surprisingly quiet (yes, I've read some of the other reviews that may disagree). After a day of wine tasting, our room was a perfect retreat. Elm House itself is well located - just off Hwy 29 at First Street. It is close to downtown Napa; a small premium outlet is west of Hwy 29 south of First Street. Easy on/'off freeway access and close to the wineries along the Hwy 29 corridor (Yountville, Oakville, Rutherford, St. Helena, and Calistoga) and the Silverado Trail. Would I stay here again? Yes, absolutely, undoubtedly, positively - matter of fact, I'm checking my calendar now!! Lee Salinas, CA

Reviews.Title: “In agreement with others!”
Reviews.Author: 1Clayton
Reviews.Content: I agree with the many reviews. More like a B&B than a Motel. We had a newer room in the back on the 2nd floor. The room was very large and all the amenities you would want are there. A great deal of thought went into the planning for the newer units. I don't know what the older units are like in the main building. The breakfast was very good and the location couldn't be better. All in all, a very well run property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: princessbride029
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Elm House and loved it. The employees were very personable and helpful, and the whole place felt like a bed and breakfast much more than a hotel. It's about 10- 20 or more minutes from the multiple wineries in the area (depending on which one - 10 from Mondavi, 20 min from V. Sattui, we loved both). Also very close to downtown (5 or 6 blocks). Our room was large and very clean, with slightly victorian decorations that were pleasant. The bathroom was average sized and also very clean. My husband loved the shower rod that bowed out in a semicircle to make more room in the shower. The water pressure was fine. Our room was on the front of the inn, which is on a relatively main road, so it was a little traffic-noisy but not enough to keep us awake or anything. The lobby area is nice and has a fireplace and couches to sit on with magazines to read and flyers from different wineries. When we got there, one of the ladies was putting out fresh cookies from the oven which were excellent! There is also an outdoor patio and a spa area (spa was covered while we were there). The breakfast here is complimentary, and incredible! Best continental breakfast I've had in a while. They had toast and bagels, fresh fruit, Yoplait yogurt (my favorite), grapefruit, cold cereals, and homemade oatmeal with as many add-ins as you could wish for. To top it all off, homemade belgian waffles with hot syrup. It was all delicious and very filling. Another plus - checkout isn't till noon, so you can relax in your room after a big breakfast before having to pack up and leave. The staff were genuinely nice and caring. One lady even found some aspirin from her own purse for my husband who had a bad headache. They were very helpful in making recommendations for wineries and restaurants as well, and the lobby has a giant book full of menus from nearby restaurants. They offered to make reservations for us, too, on the night we arrived. Many of the restaurants are either on 29 near the wineries or in downtown. Overall, a very comfortable and nice place to stay while in Napa. If we could have stayed longer, we would have, and we would definitely recommend this place to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Lohms
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want a comfortable, nice, centrally located place. Considering how expensive other places are in the area, this place is a tremendous value since it offers most of the charms of a Bed and Breakfast without the high prices. The owners are very friendly, the continental breakfast is definitely a step above what you'd normally get, and the room we had was new, very clean, attractively decorated, and very roomy. Probably the biggest BW room I've seen (FYI - we had room 402. The property doesn't look like normal Best Westerns. In fact, when we pulled into the parking area, I wasn't sure we were in the right place). The property is located on a quiet street right off Hwy 29 and close to downtown Napa and is just a stone's throw from the Napa Outlets. Next time I go to Napa, I'll definitely stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Elm House 'B&B'”
Reviews.Author: lauracro
Reviews.Content: The Elm House is more B&B than hotel. The staff are friendly, helpful, and polite. The breakfast is wonderful and a step or two above the continental breakfast advertised, with made to order waffles and actual cooked oatmeal with a variety of toppings. The fireplace is wonderful and the whole place screams 'Inn'. Please try not to stay just off the lobby by the computer desk, though. The breakfast noise did wake us as the breakfast bar is just outside the door. This is a great place to use as a cozy base for wine exploration. I did not see any small children and other than breakfast time this is a very quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect respite in wine country”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravels1
Reviews.Content: Thank you TripAdvisor members! You did not let us down here! We stayed at Elm House the week between Christmas and New Years and were absolutely impressed with this quaint little hotel. It's truly a gem. Tom and his lovely wife, the innkeepers, will do everything in their power to make your stay the best it can be. Location: Located right off one of Napa's main highways (but not ON the highway -don't worry), Elm House is easily accessible and is a great central spot if you are looking to explore all parts of the Napa region. It's not within walking distance to anything, though, so you'll want to rent a car (but that's pretty standard in Napa - you really do need a car to see the region.) Rooms: We stayed in a king suite, which had a cozy fireplace and bathroom with large jacuzzi tub. It was traditionally decorated, comfortable and quiet. Service: Superb. Friendly, personal service at its best. They helped with everything from scheduling cabs to making dinner reservations to recommending wineries to getting driving directions. We were blown away. Food: The "continental" breakfast in the mornings is more like a full-service meal, with the servers offering to toast breads and bringing around fresh-from-the-oven muffins to your table. If you go, you MUST try the homemade belgium waffles. So good. And, every afternoon, you'll find scrumptious cookies with a fresh assortment of coffee, cider and teas. A perfect treat after a day at the wineries. Price: You can't beat the great prices at this hotel! Even the nicest rooms here are way less than the other B&B's in the area. Elm House - please don't change a thing! We will be back! Thank you for a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: JAFDEH
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what everyone else has said about this place. The staff were extremely friendly. My only gripe would be the location of our room; it opened into the breakfast (lobby) area. While we never felt disturbed by the noise. it just felt a bit cramped in the mornings. This will in no way prevent us from staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the elm House Inn”
Reviews.Author: twyford
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful Christmas in the Napa valley, the Elm House Inn was lovely. Staff were really friendly and helpful and the breakfast very good, only complaint was I put on too much weight (could not resist the waffles). Atmosphere was truly festive with a large Christmas tree, warm fire and seasonal music Room spacious and comfortable Outdoor jacuzzi, a real treat after a busy day. It was good value for money and would recommend this hotel. Definately the Best Great Western that we have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Great gem!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Kay
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say! Our room had a fireplace, and was very well maintained. We had no problems with the wireless internet. They had great customer service, and were very helpful with dinner and winery suggestions. Breakfast was good, and they had a good variety of food for a continental breakfast. The location would probably be walking distance to restaurants in the summer, but it was a little cold to do so in the winter! We were next to the elevator, and had no problems with noise from the elevator or other rooms. Excellent stay! One warning: we flew in to San Francisco, rented a car from Payless Rent-a-car, and drove to Napa. We had mechanical problems and Payless employees were very unhelpful. We also had a bad experience with Payless in Denver, and will never rent from Payless again. They are the cheapest car rental for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hizzys
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Simply put, it's one of the best bed and breakfast style places i have ever been too, even though thats not how it is listed. We just got engaged and were staying at this hotel and believe me that staying there was a real treat! In the afternoon they had warm cookies and for breakfast they fed us large belgin waffles. What more could you ask for? The inn staff were simply incredible and friendly all the time. Made us both feel like we were at home, especially since they decorated the lobby with Christmas decor. The bed was listed as a queen, but they were more like a king and were super comfortable. The only two very very minor complaints that i have is that the fireplace room isn't real wood (just gas), and the soap that is provided had some black spots in it which were kinda rough on my skin (natural to the soap itself). Other than those very minor complaints, this place is simply one of the best properties around!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: lmorrinamc
Reviews.Content: My brother and I spent a couple of nights here at the end of November. We needed a place to "crunch numbers" and do some year-end work/strategic planning for our company. I decided to give the Elm House a try because of all the positive posts here at TripAdvisor. The whole experience was wonderful - in fact we're bringing our wives back so we can enjoy the hotel/area when we don't have to worrry about business. The rooms have both wireless and Ethernet connections - so we were both able to fire up our laptops and plug into the office. The Elm House is a comfortable 20 minute walk from downtown Napa - along the way you can admire a number of restored Victorians. We like to walk and we don't like to drive after drinking, so this was perfect for us. It also gave us a chance to stretch our legs after sitting in front of laptops for hours. I think we made the walk 5 times over the two days we were there. This is NOT your typical Best Western - I think it only has 10 rooms - 6 upstairs and 4 downstairs. Think "small, country inn" and you'll have a better idea of what the hotel is like. The staff is wonderful, the breakfasts ARE better than most continental breakfasts, and you have to try the Belgium Waffles. This place is a great value for the area - I think we paid about $100 a night. For the price (or twice the price) you can't beat it. My only concern now is that the more people who hear about/experience this place, the harder it will be to get reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Napa! Feels like a B&B, in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: Callie_44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with friends and LOVED it! The staff was exceptionally helpful and the breakfast is to die for. It's the greatest continental breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. We made sure to get a freshly made waffle every morning. The cookies in the afternoon was a nice touch too. So good! Other bonuses.... we had two sinks in our double room. So one was in the bathroom itself and one was right outside. This made getting ready in the morning a breeze. No more waiting on one another to get ready. Free (and ample) parking was also a big plus. No matter what time we came and went, we never had problems parking when we came back. There is also a Safeway a few blocks from the hotel. This was nice because it allowed us to get a big case of water to keep in the room/car. And we definitely went through it. Overall, I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Napa. Who knew a Best Western could feel like a cozy B&B??

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RobertsMom
Reviews.Content: Lovely Inn. We recently stayed here during a weekend trip to Napa. Our room was well appointed. The Inn has a secret garden in the back. Breakfast was prepared and ready for us daily. There was always a nice snack in the evenings when we arrived back at the Inn. The staff was friendly and helpful. They are well organized and able to get you suggestions on restaurants and area attractions. I've attached a picture of the main lobby that I took - we stayed right before Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: tipsytravler
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Elm House. Very clean, comfortable beds, lovely ambiance. Yes it is on a busy street but when you walk through the inviting lobby and smell the fresh cider and feel the warmth from the fireplace all is right with the world. Excellent Inn.

Reviews.Title: “it felt like home”
Reviews.Author: BakersfieldAnnie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 3 nights at the Elm House Inn. What a great time we had ! Great location ! Our room was beautiful and spacious. It really felt like home. The breakfast had many choices and I tried them all. The employees were very nice and polite. Connie & Tommy gave us some great tips on local resturants and things to do during the day. I will be going back to Napa and the Elm House Inn !

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: PhilGab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon for 3 nights before heading to San Fran. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding restaurants nearby. We got a great rate ($139) on a deluxe room and stayed on the second floor in the old building. I would not recommend staying on the first floor, especially in rooms 104 & 105 as they are directly outside the dining area and lack some privacy and could be noisy in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Weekend In The #1 Inn”
Reviews.Author: OTBART1
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal and have been using the tripadvisor website reviews to choose my hotel destinations. I have not once been disappointed in my choices. Again, I chose the #1 hotel in Napa Valley and I am forever grateful that it was perfect for the women in my family to celebrate 2 of our birthdays. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The four of us stepped into a Bed and Breakfast feel that was welcoming with fresh cookies and apple cider, followed by warm smiles from Tom. The room was very clean with plenty of space for all of us. Upon our return from a great dinner at Bistro Don Giovanni the fireplace was roaring and we sat down by the fire with our glass of wine purchased from a great winery Chateau Montelena (Calistoga). After a quick dip in the hot tub we headed back to our room. The next morning we woke up to the smells of fresh Belgium waffles and fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff were very attentative and quick to make us feel like we were special. It was sad to leave, but we have decided to make this a yearly trip and I will be calling Tom soon to book us a room, this time for 2 nights. Thanks again to Tom and the staff at the ELM HOUSE INN for making our stay feel like were at home.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met some friends and family for a few days of wine tasting. We picked Elm Street based on some reviews. It was a third the price of places in the area (my brother paid three times our price). We were surprised by the care of the owners and the service. We were treated like old friends. The rooms were older, but well maintained. We had a fireplace. Breakfast was provided. It was more like a bed and breakfast than a Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent internet service”
Reviews.Author: LWL
Reviews.Content: This was the priciest hotel we had during a 2 week trip from Portland down the coast and in to Sacramento. We stayed 2 nights at the Elm House. I wasn't sure what to expect since the prices are generally high in Napa, but the Elm House was top quality. Since this was the best internet connection we'd had for several days, we spent more time lounging around the hotel than we normally do - with a few bottles of excellent wine, of course! We used both their wired and wireless internet. Plus there were many outlets in the room to charge all of our electronic gadgets. Everything else was great - the breakfast, the room, the friendliness of the staff, the in-room coffee, the parking. We went on the wine train for lunch (our first time) then just wandered around downtown. The lunch was beautiful, delicious, and relaxing and the scenery, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lotsanivanh
Reviews.Content: after reading all of the positive reviews we made a reservation to stay at the elm house inn. upon recommendations of other reviewers we requested an outter room and were given room 402, which was not a typical hotel room but rather a nice sized suite. the high ceilings were a plus. the mini fridge located in the powder room was pretty convenient also. i am not sure how recent the renovations were done, but everything appeared new and decor was done relatively tastefully. in the morning we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast including belgian waffles, fruits, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, juice and hot beverages. it was a nice way to start the morning. overall, we were very pleased with our stay at the inn. we would definitely return if we needed accomodations in napa and hope that next time will be a longer stay. due to our overall pleasant experience i felt compelled to share a review and attach some photos as well. unfortunately from the photos the feeling of being at a bed and breakfast rather than a hotel chain is not captured, but i hope it is helpful for those who are looking for a nice place to stay. and thank you everyone for your reviews and steering us in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected treat”
Reviews.Author: 6pack
Reviews.Content: The online photos don't do this hotel justice. We learned from the staff that it's classified as a "boutique" hotel, which has the comfy features of a B&B. It is charming, clean, nicely furnished, homey, spacious, and the breakfast was much better than average. The staff was very helpful and we hope to make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Elm House Inn -Yes,Yes,Yes”
Reviews.Author: tootsdwales
Reviews.Content: Even with the help of Trip Advisor, it took me a long time to plan our trip to N. California. I was considering staying at Yountville- far too expensive and what a disappointment when I actually went there. (Did I miss something or is there really just that rip off bakery that has the nerve to sell coffee at over the top prices and then to expect you to drink it from a disposable cup, a couple of hotels and a few twee shops?) So I decided on Napa.The reviewers on Trip Advisor are all correct- The Elm House Inn is great! Large well decorated, spotlessly clean room, good size bathroom excellent continental breakfast- and those waffles! This was my first experience of home made waffles and I thought I would never manage a whole one- WRONG- they were so light and fluffy- delicious. Also cookies etc. in afternoon were very welcome. We tasted the wine on a Thursday p.m. and that too was excellent with plenty of tasty nibbles to help it down. Napa itself was a bit dead but an excellent centre for touring wine country. However it did have a selection of restaurants some of which we investigated (see separate reviews of the best and the worst) P.S. Copia is well worth a visit esp. for the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Elm House Inn”
Reviews.Author: Spagone
Reviews.Content: Reviewing the trip advisor favorable comments of this hotel, we booked a room on August 20-23, 2007. When we arrived, we were somewhat surprised that this was not your typical Best Western Hotel. More like a bed and breakfast. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom and shower was excellent. We felt the hotel was very convenient to the winery's, and an easy drive to downtown Napa.. Did not have much involvment with the staff. Our room 401 was very quiet and comfortable. We felt that their complimentary breakfast was fun and adequate with Fresh baked Waffles, bagels,oat meal, pastries, fruit, juices,yogurt and coffee. We found several excellent Resturants in downtown Napa. Other than the busy traffic on Highway 29, we had a great time at the hotel and the wine country.
